Reviews.Title: “Another great timeshare vacation”
Reviews.Author: dermgoddess
Reviews.Content: This trip was only for 4 days to celebrate a birthday. The amenities and condo are consistently wonderful. The location is ideal for day trips or a short flight to the grand canyon. My only criticism is the overpriced, mediocre food served at the poolside grille. In fact, the "fast-food" chain restaurants in the nearby mall are better quality and more variety. Overall, beautiful new property, with nice pools and golf. The best feature is the ability to use the neighboring JWMarriott property.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mego1216
Reviews.Content: Canyon Villas is very typical of other Marriott Vacation Clubs locations; great service, atmosphere and amenities. This particular one is better than most because it includes access to the JW Marriott across the street (great pools, lazy river and spa). My two complaints are the shuttle, which was unreliable (anywhere from leaving 3 minutes early to 20 minutes late) and lack of non feather duvets (sleeping with a thin blanket isn't what I expect from the Marriott). If they can fix these issues, will earn my title of best Marriott Vacation Club ever!

Reviews.Title: “excellent property and service”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyage555
Reviews.Content: We are owners here and elsewhere...we like this property the best...wonderful ambiance. excellent service. Management is available and on top of things. we go here very year for a month in the spring and again for 10 days in October. Will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Brand spanking new.”
Reviews.Author: BixUS
Reviews.Content: Top notch condos - Clean well furnished. Has full kitchen / washer / dryers - it's for time share owners after all. There were multiple pool areas plus a bocce court. Handy shop to purchase small items since stores are a bit far away. Free shuttle to the main Desert Ridge hotel where there are great pools.

Reviews.Title: “Another Quality Marriott Timeshare Resort”
Reviews.Author: sceneisle
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Canyon Villas is located about 21 miles from Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport and minutes away from Scottsdale and downtown Phoenix. The resort features studio, one and two bedroom units, plenty of amenities & activities, many nearby restaurants, priviledged access to the amenities of the neighboring J.W. Marriott resort, free parking and complimentary in-room wireless internet. Ours was a three generation family vacation. Our two-bedroom, air-conditioned villa (2901 & 2902) was made up of a one bedroom unit with an adjoining studio unit. We arrived at 1:30 p.m. and were given access to the studio side only, as the one bedroom unit was still being readied. Full access did not come until after 4:30 p.m.. The studio was size of an average hotel room and was furnished with a king size bed and a pull-out sofa and table in the sitting area. The kitchenette included a small refrigerator, microwave oven, small sink, coffee maker, toaster and was furnished with dinnerware for two persons. The one-bedroom unit was nicely furnished and included a washer/dryer, full kitchen with oven, all basic appliances, cookware and dinnerware for six persons. There were two minor maintenance issues (no signal on one of the televisions and an unworkable safe); both of which were resolved within 15 minutes of our phone call. The resort offers two types of maid service: a "full clean" and a "tidy clean." There is a charge for both services if you are staying on a timeshare ownership or exchange. One "tidy clean" service is included if you are paying a nightly rate. This was the first Marriott timeshare resort we have stayed at that did not include at least one mid-week "tidy clean" service for timeshare owners/exchangers. Resort amenities at the M.C.V. include serveral swimming pools, including a lap and chilren's pool, spas, fitness center, steam rooms, pool tables, children's playground, barbeque grills, fire pits, mini-market, restaurant (bar & grill) and activities desk (scheduled activities for all ages occur throughout the day). Amenities at the neighboring J.W. Marriott include golf (two courses) several restaurants & lounge, nature & preserve trails, tennis courts, and four acres of waterways including swimming pools, whirlpools and a "lazy river". It should be noted that access to the J.W. Marriott pools may be restricted for M.C.V. guests if the occupancy rate on the "J.W." side is at or near capacity. A free shuttle bus operates between the two resorts on a regular schedule. The M.C.V. is just a short drive away from numerous restaurants, a large grocery store (Albertson's is less than a mile away; Costco is about five miles away), movie theater and cultural landmarks. The Desert Ridge Market Place (less than two miles) is a premier shopping, dining and entertainment destination. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the M.C.V. and highly recommend the resort for families and couples alike. Disclaimer: We are multiple week, Marriott timeshare owners (Shadow Ridge - Palm Desert, CA and Maui Ocean Club - Maui, HI) and have stayed at eight different Marriott timeshare properties.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fine Marriott”
Reviews.Author: cmrtraveler
Reviews.Content: We are owners in Orlando and decided to try Arizona for the first time. Our friends own at this location and suggested it for us. We were not disappointed at all! As usual, Marriott always shines as a leader in resort property. We did arrive early that day (check in at 4:00 p.m.) but they took our cell phone # and we went across the street to the J.W. Marriott property so our son could enjoy the lazy river. Our room was ready promptly at 4:00 p.m. Check-in was a breeze as usual - very friendly staff and concierge has lots of information on local happenings. We were in a studio which we felt was rather small compared to other studios we've stayed in but nonetheless very impressive: sink, microwave and min-fridge. Enough to store pop, chips, lunch meat, bread etc for breakfast and lunch meals. We went out for dinner each night at the nearby Desert Ridge Shopping area. The resort was beautiful - pool area spectacular and clean. We spent a few relaxing days at the pool and our 11 year old son made some great friends while there! Food at the pool was pretty good and priced right. Drinks were wonderful as well. The location of the resort was close to the highways and best of all was the Desert Ridge shopping area just a few blocks away: Albertsons (grocery), Target, Kohls, Old Navy, AMC Movie Theatre just to name a few. Restaurants galore: Mimi's Cafe, Wolfley's, Rock Bottom, California Pizza Kitchen, In & Out Burger, Dave & Buster's...too many to mention. Nice place to take the family at night to walk around-beautiful outdoor setting with food/ice cream shops. Live entertainment on Friday nights. Be sure to use the coupon book Marriott gives you - discounts at many local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious 1-bedroom suite that accommodates family of 6”
Reviews.Author: Brad H
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in 4 months. In addition to the pools on location, Marriott gives you access to the JW Desert Ridge pools and lazy river as it has a free shuttle every hour. Great value through the selling of inventory time share weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place -- loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Margie R.
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott timeshare owner (Monarch on Hilton Head Island, S.C.), I didn't think we'd be disappointed at Canyon Villas. And I was right -- we loved it. The villas are spacious, well laid out and very clean when we arrived. I'm not sure there's a "bad" villa location since the complex is well kept all over and not as large as some we have visited. It just depends on what is important to you -- golf course view, right by the pool, quiet area, etc. It's any easy walk from most any villa to any one of the pools. Main pool area with waterfall, by the way, is very nice! Plenty of chairs/towels, with even quite a few chairs in the shade for those that aren't "sunworshipers". Plenty to do even around the perimeter of the pool (foosball, table tennis, snack bar, etc.) if you get tired of sunbathing or swimming. Staff was excellent -- very friendly and helpful. Shuttle left every half hour to the main JW Marriott hotel that is adjacent to Canyon Villas. You have full access to the hotel and facilities staying at the Canyon Villas. And what a beautiful place it is. Many pools, lazy river, restaurants, entertainment, etc. Back to the shuttle, it leaves every hour for the shopping center/restaurants, movie theater -- about a 4-minute ride from the Villas. So if you didn't plan on doing a lot of sightseeing in the Phoenix area and just want to relax, you could get by without a car by using the shuttle or sign up for one of the many tours the Villa offers. Also, the golf course is right there with shuttle service to that also. Several mornings complimentary "get togethers" are offered in the Main Reception area, e.g., coffee/doughnuts one morning to acquaint you with the area/tours; cereal breakfast another; fruit another; salsa tasting in the p.m., etc. All in all, a delightful place to stay with lots to see and do -- or do nothing but look at the beautiful scenery and enjoy the complex. What a great stay -- no complaints whatsoever. Going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Golf Paradise and Baseball - send your wife to the mall”
Reviews.Author: D_Bondman
Reviews.Content: mother-in-law were more comfortable. Only buildings 2300 and 2400 have non-lockoff 2br units. Two big groups of guests were the baseball fans in town for Spring training and the golfers here to tee it up in advance of the golf season up North. Look at http://www.cactusleague.com/ for more baseball information. Look at golfnow.com for course information and discount tee times. The Vacation Club resort was built in phases from 2004-2008 and units are still pretty new and at the higher Marriott standard of this recent period. The main pool is very nice, as a large fake rock formation which provides some shade seating, privacy, and a waterfall. There is a small shack for drinks and food; expect to pay too steep hotel prices for the convenience. But hey, if you care about your budget, buy some 12 packs of pop (beer?) at CVS and some plastic cups. Behind the rock formation is a small private waterfall and sun-bathing area and a hot-tub. This would definitely be the topless area of a European resort, but this ain't Europe. There are two other water areas. One is a two foot deep wading pool called Lizard Lagoon and the other is a small 4 foot deep almost hot-tub pool for soaking and talking. Temp is kept around 90-95 degrees. This is probably Sweeeet in February when the outside temp is 45-60 degrees. A new lounging courtyard has been installed between buildings 2400-2500-2600 and is my favorite place at the resort. Five seating areas are under large sun-sails which provide a filtered shade. There are also two seating areas around fire pits. The courtyard is home to shuffleboard courts, a herb garden, and a stretch of lawn used for Yoga and exercise every morning. You get full access to the pool, lazy river, restaurants, and spa at the JW Marriott next door. This is a big plus. The Wildfire Golf Club has two courses by Palmer and Faldo. The LPGA has a new tour stop here and the play next week and will play 18 holes using the back nine of both courses. It is a 6-7 minute walk or you could take the shuttle or drive. The Desert Ridge Marketplace has around 15 restaurants, 30 stores, CVS, Albertsons, a Bank os America and Starbucks. We seemed to be at the Paradise Bakery and Einstein Bagel a lot. I walked both ways to get breakfast in the morning. The shuttle will take you and pick up up. Albertson's and CVS is a must see because the Marriott Marketplace is the smallest I ever saw and prices are always better at a real store. Unit selection tips: Consider your favorite activities and the temperature/sun direction. The units by the pool are very convenient to the lobby, fitness center, etc. I like the courtyard and the shade. The East facing villas have a golf course view and morning sun. The South facing villas sound like a bad idea after April when temps are 100+. Building 2900 South facing units watch the traffic on the entrance road and the lobby parking lot. If you have not spent time in Phoenix, pay special attention to temperatures and clothing layers. Mornings are very cool in February and March. We had some days around 60 degrees and some days in the 80's. The air is very dry and we had a lot of allergy problems from dust and spring pollens. (Spring here is the end of February) This review is only for the second week of my stay. The first week had several housekeeping and maintenance issues.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: 2go4world
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Canyon Villas February 9 through February 13, 2012. This Marriott property is absolutely beautiful. Although it seems to be in the middle of a very busy city, it is an oasis. The grounds are immaculate and appear to be trimmed with nail scissors. The little bunnies on the green lawns in early morning and early evening were so peaceful. Our room/condo was, as usual with Marriott, spotless and welcoming. We couldn't have asked for anything nicer! Just down the street was a large shopping area with lots of great restaurants and shops, many new to us. It was fun investigating them! And north of the villas is Cave Creek which was a delightful afternoon of walking and exploring. The temperature in February was perfect - about 65 degrees with lots of sun. Brian, the concierge, although new was very helpful. Always cheerful, as all the staff was, and looking out for our interests. Great stay!! Will definitely come again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Loves_snorkeling_7
Reviews.Content: We checked in yesterday and spent today exploring Canyon Villas and the JW Marriott next door. Staff at both are very friendly and helpful. Ate at the Marriott and were able to charge it to our room at the Villas. Several pools, hot tubs, and restaurants are available with a free shuttle between the two resorts that runs every half hour. My husband and I have a one bedroom suite with kitchen - lots of room and two televisions. Great place for long walks. We don't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel01960
Reviews.Content: My extended family and I visited Canyon Villas and we had a great time. There were 12 of us and we had two 2 bedroom units. The units are beautiful. They have everything you need if you want to save money on meals. The pools are gorgeous. The property is well maintained. The staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Shame JW is so close”
Reviews.Author: Darthy
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four and Marriott Vacation owners at Grande Vista - Orlando, FL., That is why we interchange very often with other Marriott properties. In this case, I was disappointed because the property does not have tennis courts or even a better pool. (By the way, the week of 12/11/11, when we arrived, the pool was closed). The JW is very close but you need to walk or drive. I rather like to have all these in the same place. It's a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Need a better pool”
Reviews.Author: BettyKR
Reviews.Content: This Marriott vacation villa has a deal with the JW Marriott on the same property. Guests here can use the amenities over THERE. That's the problem. It's over THERE. The towels have the same color so you don't feel like a lowly cousin. However, we had to carry all our stuff over THERE and cut the stay short to come back and get lunch. THEY have the lazy river and the slide. We have a couple of small pools and according to my son, the largest jacuzzi with a waterfall that he's ever seen. The two properties combined is quite nice. But it is a trek to get to the lazy river.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall quality, although some service issues were lacking”
Reviews.Author: TigerAL
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit to the Marriott Canyon Villas near Desert Ridge, staying each time as time-share exchangers or on a promotional package. Overall, I like the facility, although some amenities and service issues could be better. Main pool area is nice and has a variety of sitting areas, although depending on where you stay in the resort getting there means either you have to cross multiple parking lots or simply walk along paths, which of course is more preferrable. A nice "quiet pool" lies on the far edge of the property; it's a smaller area and is more of an expanded, free-form spa than a pool; no deep end, not enough room to swim but larger than the typical round hot tub. It was much more relaxing there than at the main pool where it can tend to get crowded and noisy. Regarding technology, their WiFi AND guest computer terminals in the lobby were down for 3 days; I deliberately like to travel light and therefore if a reputable hotel and resort has its own business center or computers, I'm going to take a chance and leave my own equipment at home or in the office. I'll use theirs instead of taking my laptop or have to rely on my smart-phone. Lesson learned: even in a good facility such as this tech problems can occur, which they did. Note to self - and others: bring your own so you're not without that medium of communication if you were depending on it. Inside my guestroom, the functionality of the TV remote was a joke. Buttons were sticky, many simply didn't even transmit a signal. I should've asked for a better working one, but by the 3rd I was so frustrated with that and their computers being down I just gave up. Another issue had to do with service. Being a timeshare owner (not in the Marriott family0 I successfully exchanged into the Canyon Villas. My stay was in the middle of October, not exactly peak season like Jan-March, or through Spring Break, which to us Northern Mid-Westerners, goes into the 2nd week of April. I called the Canyon Villas directly a week ahead of my stay and asked about the possibility of obtaining a larger 1-BR instead of the smaller one I had exchanged into. I received a very curt response of "No, we're absolutely full." OK, I can buy that. I can also completely accept the limitations of my exchange. The only problem I had was that once I got there, the place was half-empty. If the hostess answering the phone the day I called would've taken the time to simply explain their policy of limiting exchangers only into smaller units, I could've accepted that as an honest, professional response. I remember thinking once I was there: if this facility is full, it means alot of people must've walked here or taken cabs from the airport, because some buildings on the grounds had NO cars in their dedicated parking lots. But to get there and find that her response was just one of convenience and untrue, it did leave alot to be desired as to Marriott's integrity. In thinking about it, whether or not I was in the large or small unit, it's arguably the same maintenance costs on their end: I'm going to use the same amount of linens, towels and soap regardless of which size unit I'm going to stay in. The units themslves are nice enough, although Marriott could take a page or two from Westin, Hilton or others when it comes to updating room decor. Interesting to note that as a Marriott member (hotels, not the timeshare division) I've stayed in newer Marriott Residence Inns which had nicer interiors than at the Canyon Villas. I still like the Canyon Villas, especially for its north central Phoenix location and the JW Desert Ridge, which is right "next door". It's worth it to walk over there for "happy hour" and to tour their beautifult property as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property and respectful of many religions”
Reviews.Author: Pueblochick
Reviews.Content: For many years, my husband and two children have vacationed around the US during the holiday season. Canyon Villas is THE FIRST to offer the lighting of Hanukaah candles, for those of us who don't celebrate Christmas. We are so appreciative of this! Thanks, Marriott Canyon Villas, for helping us celebrate our holiday traditions away from home. We also greatly enjoyed the beauty of the grounds, proximity to JW Marriott, lovely units and view, and quiet and peaceful atmosphere. We've had a great week!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: csheetz
Reviews.Content: As a 2 week Timeshare owner at Canyon Villas, I asked for a Golf Course view well in advance. Received a room at the very end, opposite of new construction for an addition. No view. Cable TV is also under construction and we were told it will be until year's end to be repaired. All channels are fuzzy throughout Resort, and many majors not watchable. We were there during World Series week and had to find Sports Bars to view the TV. Yes, the cable service is that bad! The Internet service was also down frequently during our stay, We were instructed to go to JW Hotel to print boarding passes. Our room was quite dark. Several lamps had 3-ways but light bulbs were singles.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott--Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: targated
Reviews.Content: Great location for golfers with many courses nearby. Room, pool & hot tub in very nice shape. They even have an adults only pool.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: DiegoFlorida
Reviews.Content: We traded for a week with Interval. We had a nicely decorated 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom unit with a full kitchen, living room and dining area, plus a washer and dryer. Our second bedroom had a mini fridge and coffeemaker.We were in the 2900 area and it was very quiet. We had a newspaper by our front door every morning (USA Today). The kitchen had all the appliances we could need. We were given some coffee and laundry detergent to start our stay. If we needed more we had to buy them. Also some little bottles of shampoo and conditioner. There was enough dish soap, garbage bags, paper towels toilet paper and kleenex to get us through the whole week. There is no cleaning service unless you want to pay quite a bit extra but we did not need it. We just did a load of the towels several times a week in our unit and made our own bed. The pool area looked very nice although we did not use it. There was a room with weights which we did not use and a different room with cardio which we did use several times. Plenty of cardio machines and each had their own TV attached. The room was also kept very clean. Check in was very easy and they were very nice at the counter. There was a concierge in the lobby which we did not need. We were very close to Desert Ridge Shopping area where there are so many popular stores and restaurants. We actually walked there from our unit one day and it was a nice walk. We passed the golfing section which is right on the property and it looked really nice. We were given a pass key to the pool at the Marriott Hotel which is just a short drive up the road but we did not use it. The pool at our Villas looked nice enough if we needed one. I saw many free shuttle buses come to the front entrance all day long. They have many fun planned activities every day and gave us a schedule but we were unable to attend any of them. Check out is at 10am but we left a day early. It was a 25 minute drive to the airport. We had only one small complaint and it is that the glass shower door off the main bedroom did not close all the way. Other than that due to the excellent location, cleanliness and quiet room we would come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: srp2775
Reviews.Content: Everything was great here. We are a family of four and had a two bedroom unit. We requested the top floor, which was quiet. Our room was in the last building 3300, and our balcony faced the quiet pool. It was only noisy in there once, when kids were in the pool. (not sure if they are allowed in there...). So all in all, we didn't have noise problems in or out of our unit. The hotel's location was great, being in close proximity to a highway and maybe about 25-30 min. from the airport. There is a big shopping center, Desert Ridge Marketplace, very close, which has an Albertson's and CVS. There were also a lot of chain stores and restaurants there, too. I brought our two sons, ages 2 and 5, to a play place in the mall. (can't remember name). It was only $5 each on Fridays. It was money well spent, as they were occupied for about an hour. The place is very small, though, having one inflatable slide and a climbing structure. Older children may be bored here. There is also a small play area for the 2 and under group, but we didn't go there. Don't forget socks, as shoes are not allowed on the play sets. The service at the front desk and pool cafe was wonderful. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. We needed towels one night, and they were delivered within 10 min. We only had maid service once, but he/she did a great job. I accidentally left out over $200 cash on the nightstand, and it wasn't touched. The kitchen was stocked, too. You don't need to bring laundry detergent, dishwasher detergent, or dish soap. And the in-unit washer/dryer was nice. There are only two negative things. The shower head in the master bathroom could not be adjusted and just sprayed onto the wall. It wasn't really a big deal to me, though. The bed in the master bedroom was not comfortable for me, but husband thought the mattress was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lucy29KC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here October 8 - 15, 2011 using a trade thru II. We had an efficiency unit with all the typical Marriott amenities. The biggest complaint we had, which is why we knocked 1 star off, was our room location. We were in the last unit (building 3300) with our room door facing Tatum Blvd. Tatum is a very busy street all day long. We could hear traffic very clearly early in the morning for rush hour and late in the evening past 11pm. It was almost a constant hum of the cars and horns honking, etc. We did not complain to management so I'm not sure if they would have moved us or not. Other than that, the grounds were extremely nice and well taken care of. We used the pool once and there were plenty of chairs and towels. There is also a separate kids pool with sprinklers located away from the main pool. By staying there you also get access to use the JW Marriott pool. They have a shuttle that will take you there or it is a short walk over. The JW has several pools including a lazy river that was so relaxing. We got there after 9 and it didn't really start getting crowded until closer to noon. The pools open at 7 so if you get there at that time you will probably have it to yourself for awhile. The location is perfect if you are going out for spring training baseball. All the stadiums are within about a 30 minute drive. There's lots of shopping and restaurants close too. Plus the highway is close by. We would stay there again but not in building 3300.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the facilities thoroughly!”
Reviews.Author: King06
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Vacation Club owners and this was our first visit to Canyon Villas. Overall, we were very pleased with the experience. The rooms have a typical Marriott Vacation Club layout, it's roomy, tasteful and tries to reflect the local SW decor. Everything was in working order and had a nice, peaceful view of the golf course. It's centrally located (at least for the large Phoenix metro area). We didn't spend much time at the Villas itself as we did alot of sightseeing and outdoor activiies in the greater Phoenix/Arizona area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Marriott Resort”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyage555
Reviews.Content: We are owners here so, maybe a bit biased although we own elsewhere and wouldn't consider a visit there . This resort is great, well located, clean, picturesque and the service is good. We like Desert Ridge and it's location. Great shopping and restaurants nearby. Convenient to the airport...try Super-Shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “My first visit to America”
Reviews.Author: oop61
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I traveled from England where we live in Hertfordshire, just outside London. It was our first stay in America and we loved it. Our stay in Canyon Villas, was very enjoyable, we did not use the Golf Course but our room overlooked the green and it was a lovely view. We only visited the main Hotel in the evening for Dinner, all the Restaurants were very good, we did rather prefer the Restaurant called Tuscany. They all did a Glutton free menu which was helpful to me as I have an Intolerance. The shuttle bus was good to use to go over to the main Hotel, but it was only about a 12 minute walk and we did walk back sometimes. We also had a ride back in one of the larger Golf Buggies which for me a 62year old English lady was great fun. The swimming pool at Canyon Villas was very nice and although on our last day, we ventured over to use the one at the main Marriott Hotel, and that was very nice too. The Desert Ridge Market Place was, great too. We used the nice Shuttle buses to go over and sometimes we walked (25minute walk). We had the phone number of Reception and we were able to phone through from the Market place if we had walked over there, I think we confused the issue though when we walked as the driver did not know we had gone over, hence the phone call. The Shuttle go over to the Market every hour, I do not think many people walk over there. Detours was the tour people that Reception put us in touch with for our visit to Sedona, and also to Tombstone, they were very good. We used another driver, that Reception put us in touch with and I cannot praise this man enough, his first name was "Richard" and he was brilliant. Our holiday was very good. We did accept the 90 minute sales talk, this was not forced on us at all, and for listening we were given a $100 voucher to spend in any of the Restaurants at the Hotel. As we live in England and not in America we would not buy into this holiday, (We 2 apartments we have bought into in Malta) Although we have bought a weeks holiday here, which we will enjoy again in 2013. I loved the scenery. When we return, we will know to add another 2 hours to the 6 hours when we put our watches to Phoenix time. when we first arrived in Chicago, we put our watches back 6 hours. Phoenix are 8 hours behind us in England. For the first three days in Phoenix we wondered why none of your shops opened on time and the Pool Bar also. Looking forward to our Return in 2013 this time we will visit the Grand Canyon too.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: flowerpot_11
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Marriott, It was so clean and cozy outside, flowers so beautiful and lot's of color. We went to our room and put our bags down to unpack and decided that maybe we should take a drive to the store and maybe pick up dinner and some wine. Anyway we returned back to our room and I decided to take a refreshing shower. We decided to have dinner out on the patio. I could not beleive my eyes it was so warm and cozy .It was as tho we were sitting in our own back yard. Just the peice and quiet and even tho we were by the street you could not really here the traffic. Lets just say this is a trip I will never forget. So If you go to Phoenix and need some where to stay the Marriott's Canyon Villas is the place for you.Oh the first floor is the best for this home away from home stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: snarkee
Reviews.Content: PROS Large 2 BR, lots of nice touches, super clean, comfy beds. Stayed on top floor/end unit as advised by previous review here-- so no noise above. Tx for the tip! CONS Lots of walking & driving to get around complex .. not so fun in 115 degree weather! Had to call at 4 pm to get room cleaned...disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Love the place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy-Rox
Reviews.Content: We were invited by some friends members of Interval and gave us the one bedroom, one bathroom unit. We simply loved it. The bed and pillows amazing after a long day out visiting Grand Canyon and surroundings. We were able to use the pool at the Marriott Hotel nearby which is really nice. Food and drinks very good as well. We are fans of Marriott vacation Clubs. We trully enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: Furaihtnyc
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a trip where I stayed at this property for a conference. For me it was a positive experience. The room was extremely clean, attractive and had everything I needed. The balcony had a nice view and let the sun in perfectly. I did get a chance to use the swimming pool and found it very refreshing. I noticed that they were a lot less children than I thought there would be. Maybe it was the time of year but it would make me hesitate to bring my two little ones there.

Reviews.Title: “It may be "dry"," but it's still hot!”
Reviews.Author: nyrxman
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Vacation Club owners and this year we took the family to Canyon Villas in Phoenix the second week of August. We knew it was going to be hot, but we figured we would do all the pool type activities in the morning and travel about to air conditioned venues in the afternoon, and then come back in the evening when it cooled down a bit. Well every day averaged about 104-106 degrees. And while it is dry, my oven is dry and I don't stick my head in the oven. The one good thing about going in the summer I suppose is that the resort is not quite as busy. Unfortunately our stay did not start off on the right foot. After a nearly 6 hour flight and shuttling a ton of bags (there were five of us) from the airport to the hotel, all we wanted to do was go to our room, change and relax. Check in time is 4PM. We arrived shortly after 4 PM and our room was not ready, and they said they could not accommodate our request for a high floor. They finally found a room, but they said it would be about 2 hours before it would be ready. We were told later by one of the staff that during the summer, when it is much slower at the resort, they do not hire on their entire staff and this could have very well been the reason it was taking so long for the rooms to be ready. One good piece of advice is to definitely rent a car. Because we were four adults and one child, we did not rent a car at the airport because we would have needed a large car or SUV to fit all the luggage. So we rented a car at the Hertz rental agency connected to the JW Marriott Desert Ride on the other side of the street ( One of the perks of staying at the Villas is that you have access to all the facilities at the JW Marriott). We actually hired a Super Shuttle van exclusively for our family to take us to the hotel. It was very reasonable and we were all very comfortable with no problem handling the luggage. Because it was an exclusive rental (about $69 one way for all of us), there were not stops or drop offs to the hotel as there would be had we taken one of the "regular" Super Shuttles. Then we rented a much smaller and affordable car at the hotel for the rest of the week. This allowed us to try many of the great restaurants in the Scottsdale area and well as visit some great museums. One of the best museums we visited was the MIM (Musical Instrument Museum). If you like music, this is a must visit. It is a beautiful museum and very close to Canyon Villas. The facilities at Canyon Villas were ok, but not as nice as some of Marriott's other vacation club properties. We found ourselves spending more time at the hotel across the street which is magnificent. It has more pools, lazy river, choice of fine restaurants, etc. Our two bedroom villa was clean and roomy and pretty much a copy of other Marriott Vacation Club villas. All in all, we had a great time. My six year old granddaughter had a blast as well. I would not hesitate to recommend this property, but probably not in the heat of the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much, we want to go back with the kids!”
Reviews.Author: BigEagles
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort late on Tue. Aug 30 so check-in was a breeze. My wife and I were there to celebrate our 15 year anniversary without the kids. A list of activities for the week was included at check-in, and there is a little bit of something for everybody going on throughout the resort from early morning to late evening every day. We had booked the one bedroom unit which was small but adequate for two people. I travel with a blacklight to examine the room for "hidden" stains on beds/floors, etc., and to my surprise, the unit was extremely clean (I almost always find something)! These kind of things always skeeve me out, but I'm happy to report that the sheets and pillowcases were spotless! Only a couple of random stains on the couch is all I could find. The fridge and microwave came in handy, the bed was comfortable, the deck overlooking the pool was nice, and the high-speed internet was fast. Also, the parking lot had covered parking spaces, which proved extremely useful when going out in your car after a day sitting in the hot Arizona sun! The next morning, we discovered our unit didn't have a hair dryer, but after a quick call to the front desk, we had one within minutes. A visit to the concierge was extremely helpful in planning activities for us in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area, and she had advice on everything from dining to hot air balloon rides to Jeep tours in Sedona. Plus, she handed us a Marriott Vacation Card and a sheet of paper with local establishments offering various discounts when you displayed the card. The workout area is amazing -- from free weights to cardio machines -- you'll feel like you're a member at a gym. The pools are nice and stay open until 11PM. We did go over to the JW Marriott side of the resort, and it's even nicer over there! Free valet parking for Canyon Villas guests, and free access to the pools and the lazy river! You don't even have to carry cash or credit - everything gets billed back to your room which is nice. Never had a chance to go golfing, or check out many of the restaurants at the JW Marriott, so I can't comment on that, but we did volunteer to attend their 90 minute Vacation Club presentation at the suggestion of the concierge in order to get a $100 credit to resort. While the presentation was very interesting, and the vacation club seems like a good value, it wasn't within our budget at this time. Although the presentation was not high pressure, it did last nearly an hour longer than advertised so be prepared to sit there for 2.5 hours if you attend. We also chose to get 15,000 Marriott Reward points added to our membership account instead of the $100 Resort credit which basically amounts to a 1-2 nights stay at a Marriott-brand hotel (depending on the brand). Overall, we were extremely impressed with the resort and kept saying to each other how much fun the kids would have had there! We plan on taking them back!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to MVC standards - certainly doesn't compare with Spanish resorts”
Reviews.Author: electroshock
Reviews.Content: We Selected this Marriott resort forthe first week of our two week vacation in the desert, so I can now compare with another Marriott resport where we spent the 2nd week, and also compare to our "home" resort in Spain. All I can say is that we won't return to this resort! First impressions are that it resembles a concrete motel. The design is basic and uninviting. The hotel grounds are desert like (OK, yes well we were in the desert, but compared to Palm Desert grounds which are beautifully tendered, well there is no comparison. Our apartment was at the far end (future development/expansion area), near to the "quiet pool" which was in fact a spa pool, and overlooked what I would describe as scrubland. As a result I wanted to spend as little time in the resort or on our balcony as possible. Yes the JW Marriott across the road is very nice but it kind of defeats the self catering element of the vacation if you don't feel relaxed and pleased to stay in your room or on your balcony doesn't it? Compare this to our subsequent week in Desert Springs - a massive improvement and an altogether different experience for all of us including my teenage stepson who even had things to do in DS (unlike CV where he was bored out of his brain). TO anyone considering switching your tiomeshare to this resort - if you have stayed in other upscale Marriott resorts such as the Spanish ones or the Californian ones, then you will be unimpressed with this place, and I would recommend you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place - We will return!”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodBlonde
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom condo for a week and it was amazing. The condo was extremely clean and very roomy. The washer and dryer is a definite plus when you have kids travelling with you. Everyone that we dealt with was really friendly and very helpful. The main pool is very large and has lots of seating around it. There is a small cantina there as well that serves food and drink - everything can be charged directly to your room so no need to carry cash

Reviews.Title: “Had a lot of Fun”
Reviews.Author: Brandon F
Reviews.Content: Going to the Marriott Canyon Villas was a great experience. My wife and I came here on an exchange for our timeshare. Although not a fan of Arizona all together I was a fun of this resort. Our trip didn't start off too well in that it took a long time to get us checked in. We arrived early and were told that we would get a room on arrival but it took about 2 hours for a room to be ready. The good news was that we got all of our grocery shopping done while we waited and when we came back we were upgraded to a 3rd story 1 bedroom instead of the 1st floor that we were supposed to have; that was great. From here on out we had a blast. The pools on site as well as across the street were worth baring the heat to get to them (the lazy river across the street was great). The pool bars had great service and great drinks. The games were very family oriented but allowed my wife and I to play. There was also a lot of “adult" activities on site that included alcohol for a minimal fee. The rooms were also very clean and fully stocked. The kitchen was really big and worked great for all our meals. The bed and bathroom were very nice; the couch was a little hard though. 2 nice flat screen tvs in the unit; some channels didn't work or came in very faint. DVD players were very good though. Overall it was great. We did do the time share presentation but decided not to join but were given a chance to try out Marriott’s Steak House for free. Great fish and steak and of course the wine was amazing. Try the chocolate cake it was the best part.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed clean, but basic”
Reviews.Author: LarryGS
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Marriott resorts before and owning weeks at two different Marriott places in Spain, we had high expectations for Canyon Villas that were never achieved. When we checked in, it was okay, but we purely functional. our first impressions of the resort were "looks okay, nothing special". our rooms were spotlessly clean and well equipped so we thought wait until morning, maybe our first impressions aren't right. The apartment blocks are two storey and very basic and boring, the so called quiet pool area was 5 jacuzzi type pools joined together. The main pool was functional and not bad, but the pool bar/food was very disappointing. There is no bar/social area except a basic 'owners lounge'. The concierge was only interested in trying to get us to attend the sales presentation and ode she realised we were not going to attend, she did not return our requests for info. In tacit, the two concierge staff we spoke to seemed to have little knowledge of what existed outside the resort. The JW Marriott over the road, just 5 mins walks away was great. good pools and lazy river but again the food round the pool was dissapointing. However, ado go to Roys bar for happy hour, $5 for an outstanding cocktail. We are really surprised at some of the reviews of this place, it is probably 3 star as a destination, it's clean and ok, but nothing more that that, not the standard we expected and not a place we'd return to. Nothing so bad we'd complain. But can't think of much to compliment them for.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Room and Lots of Pools”
Reviews.Author: FormerBuckeye
Reviews.Content: I like Marriotts. They are consistently roomy and comfortable with updated decor. Canyon Villas are no exception. The beds are great, and there was plenty of room for the four of us. There are several pools on property and several more, including a lazy river, across the way. Being August in Phoenix, we spent a lot of time at the pools. We could always find chairs with shade no matter what time of day we went. A few times I even had the quiet pool to myself! Our stay at Canyon Villas was very comfortable and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “We come here every year (5 years straight) and love it.”
Reviews.Author: Kenneybee
Reviews.Content: This trip was great as usual. We stayed in the 3300 block next to lizard lagoon, I was a little concerned since I had read you can hear traffic in Tatum Blvd., but I never heard anything! Although for next year I think we'll stay closer to the main pool, our kids are getting older and are liking the deeper water vs. the kiddie pool. We enjoy the various resort activities they offer, such as Iron Chef competition between guests, popcorn tasting, hula-hoop competition, seems like something for every age. We look forward to next year. A few negatives I'll mentioned that bugged: over at the JW on busy days like Fridays, the lazy river had a lot of drunk adults and who knows how much alcohol they spilled in it (not loving that with my kids around)-that water was murkier than it should have been! They have suspended bus service between the villas and the JW to only once an hour from every 15 minutes last time we were there, but it turned out ok since I discovered I liked driving over more anyways. There also seems to be a lot of Mosquitos in the room (5 or 6, but mire than there should be) I don't know if it's because of the water feature in the room or it was monsoon season as well. Like I said these are nit-picks. We love it here! It's one of our family traditions to come every summer. Traveled with 3 kids, ages: 7, 4, 8 months

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but noisy”
Reviews.Author: donandmadmom
Reviews.Content: Family and I (husband 50, children 21 and 18) stayed in a suite on the second floor of building #2. Positives: Room was lovely, spacious and very clean. Pools were great. The largerst pools and 'lazy river' type pool area (where a waitress will bring you a drink right in the water as you are floating around in your tube!) is accessed via a free shuttle that takes you to the main JW Marriot about 1/4 mile away. The basic Spa massage was great . Spa is lovely with it's own (very quiet) pool area,bistro, sauna, steam room, whirlpool ,showers etc. Negatives: Walls, doors and ceiling were very THIN. Family above us had a child or two and we could hear them running around their room. I could hear a clock alarm buzzing at 6:30 a.m. for about 15 mins. in the room next door. I believe they were out early and forgot to shut of the alarm. The doors slam shut very noisily. Doors open onto open air hallways and echo terribly. Early morning sounded like a $50.00 motel! Was supposed to be a 'golf course view', but all we could see was foliage. Also, there was an overabundance of teens running around due to a soccer tournament in the area. .Tips: Stay on the top floor. Don't know what you could do about the noise of the doors however. Perhaps to be located near vacant rooms???

Reviews.Title: “First class Vacation Villa”
Reviews.Author: JoseLuisContreras
Reviews.Content: This is one of the newer version of Marriott Vacation Villa suites: spacious, very well designed, almost luxurious. Hotel guests can access the JW Marriott facilities which are a block away which complements existing offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Sky_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Marriott Canyon Villas on two different occasions, once on a family trip with a big group, and once as a getaway with my wife. On both occasions, we loved the property and found amazing value - we paid far less than the JW Marriott across the road was charging, but were given the ability to use JW's amenities. This isn't to say that the Canyon Villas is lacking on its own. There's a great pool, the grounds are very well kept, and the rooms that we had were fantastic. On both occasions we had suites that came equipped with kitchens, amazing bathrooms, flat screen televisions, and balconies. The staff were always friendly, and they had regular shuttles over to the JW. We really enjoyed both of our stays there, and would happily return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!!”
Reviews.Author: 2PrincessesandaFrog
Reviews.Content: This vacation club rental is outstanding, and even exceeded our expectations. Everything was at hand that one could need....W/D, stove, fridge, and every utensil you could possibly think of!! We didn't go the main pool, but the children's pool was outstanding. Our child loved every minute of it, as it was only 1 1/2 ft deep, and had various spray apparatus around the pool. The only downfall was that it seems that the local residents think that they can come and use the facility as well. On at least three occassions we saw "mom's" getting out of big SUV's with 7 children in tow, as well as numerous beach bags ready for a day of play. No family would travel on vacation with all the amenties and toys that these day "guests" were bringing to the pool. I phoned the front desk to make them aware of the now overcrowded pool, and those who weren't guests, and they commented that there are issues with that at the facility cinstantly. Not sure if anything was ever done about it, so it is a little frustrating for paying guests. Lots of parking available, so no trouble finding a spot. Great access to the mall across the street (a shuttle bus is available if required). The Villas also hosts a variety of activities for guests from social nights, to hikes to fitness classess. Guests at the Canyon Villas also have access to the JW Marriott facilities, which includes a lazy river. Lots of fun for the kids but it does become extremely busy on weekends. Wristbands are required here, so that helps to keep many of the locals away....although I am told that someone will rent a room and then many families will come for the day and enjoy the facilities. So be aware that it may be extremely crowded here on weekends. I would definitely go back and stay at the Villas...all the amenities of your home are available to you while staying in the suite. If you are paying for a room daily, housekeeeping is included, otherwise it isn't. So be aware if you are expecting housekeeping to keep your room fresh everyday.... Plenty of room for families. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this stay to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Villas”
Reviews.Author: LaSerena
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend at the Villas and everything was fantastic. Great service, beautiful rooms (we had two two-bedroom condos), beautiful grounds. The beds were extremely comfortable and the kitchen was well-stocked for cooking. We also used the gas grills to BBQ. We were really impressed with the staff both at the Villas and at the rest of the resort (which includes the Marriott Desert Ridge) across the street. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, even in the 105 summer temperatures. For pool time we preferred the Marriott/hotel side of the resort (the Villas office will provide you with a wristband to get pool access there). The main hotel has two pools and a lazy river. There are two pools at the Villas but the area is smaller and it feels more crowded. The hotel also has a few restaurants, including a Roy's with patio seating and happy hour from 4 to 6pm. Although we spent a lot of time on the hotel side of this resort, I always prefer the condos for kicking back, relaxing and for eating in when we want to. We'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott's Lazy River no longer a guarantee”
Reviews.Author: lfmkrmrbm
Reviews.Content: Just as an FYI for those folks who are going to the Canyon Villas and are looking forward to using the JW Marriott's pools as well: if the hotel is booked, or at full capacity, they are required to restrict, as per the city's fire dept, the number of guests in the pool area. In order to do that, they deny access to the Canyon Villa guests. Over the 4th of July weekend, Villa guests were not allowed to use the pools on the 1st thru the 4th. They already know that they will do the same for Labor Day weekend. Whether or not they will restrict for other weekends will be decided as the weekend approaches. The hotel now offers rates and packages to area residents that are cheaper for a family to go to than the other water parks nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Love Marriott Canyon Villas -- we recommend the timeshare tour & purchase”
Reviews.Author: MOTHERLOAD
Reviews.Content: We have been here 3 summers now, trading our week in Vegas or Palm Desert for a week in Phoenix. Yes, it is hot, but I love the desert & it is a relaxing, elegant vacation. Go for the Marriott tour & we encourage you to buy into the program. It is a great program for families or couples to vacation. Marriott is not high pressure & if you are not interested you will still get a gift, like $100.00 for the JW restuarants across the property. There are 2 golf courses here, Wildfire & another Faldo course i think. I don't play golf, but the courses are pretty. The Marriott landscaping is fantastic. I love the variety of desert landscaping, it is so pretty. There is also a lot of wildlife on the grounds, many birds including quail, rabbits, owls, etc. The villas come as 2 bed, 2 bath unit with washer/dryer, etc. You can also rent just 1 bedroom, or just a studio unit. Four people should have at least a 1 bedroom. Studios are good for 2 people, but don't have washer/dryer & have only mini kitchen with microwave / coffee maker, etc. We travel a lot & we own a Marriott week at Grand Chateau Las Vegas, and a week at Shadow Ridge, Palm Desert, with both being 2 bedroom units. We have stayed at Canyon Villas more than anywhere else because the Villas are roomy, the area beautiful & the choice of pools is awesome. The pools at the Villas are wonderful & there are several, but you can also go & use the pools at the JW Marriott next door. There is an exercise room on site & other amenities. We go to the Albertson's market in the Desert Ridge Center & stock up on food to cook in the villa. The villas have granite counter tops, & the Master bedroom has a room with a shower, toilet & sink, then there is a 2nd master sink counter area, & a large soaking tub. The rooms have balconies or patios with tables and chairs on them. There are BBQ's scattered around the resort you can use. There are activities you can sign up for. Free parking & free WIFI. The beds & bedding are wonderful! Also, the studio & the living room both have sofabeds. Marriott is putting in new sofas in all villas across the globe that have memory foam mattresses. This is because the existing sofabed mattresses are horrible. Marriott Mountainside condos were the test case so those units already have the new sofabeds. They are made by American Leather company. I am excited about this improvement.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT experience!”
Reviews.Author: FisherFamily94
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in a 2 bedroom villa for 5 nights. We loved having so much space to spread out and relax. The bathrooms were large, full kitchen with laundry was great too. Although we had access to the amenities at JW Marriott across the street, we only visited once for the lazy river. The pools at Canyon Villas were fantastic and our kids preferred them. We ate lunch at the poolside bar and it was very good. My big kids liked the little game area near the pool (foosball, air hockey, pool). The resort is close to the Desert Ridge shopping and restaurants. We walked there one day, my 4 year old struggled some because it was very hot - but the walk is doable and would be nice in cooler weather. The Desert Ridge mall has a water play area for little ones, great place to visit and shop. We would stay at Canyone Villas again without a doubt. Short easy drive to Scottsdale and downtown Phoenix...loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of room for the whole family at Marriott's Canyon Villas!”
Reviews.Author: docbroker
Reviews.Content: This is the time share location for Marriott at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge Resort. The great thing about it is that you have full access to the resort (across the street), but you have all of the amenities of home. The pools are incredible as is the spa and golf course. Best of all, the kids have their own space as do the adults! Plus, you have extras that the resort cannot provide like free covered parking, full kitchen, 3 flat screen tv's, and a w/d in the unit. All this for about the same cost as one hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: bneater
Reviews.Content: Looking through the reviews for Marriott's Canyon Villas, it is difficult to find a negative review, which was encouraging. I almost became overwhelmed with thinking that I would be the exception...but, happily...I wasn't. Marriott's Canyon Villas is a GREAT resort with everything you'd want in a vacation. We stayed in a two-bedroom villa during the first week of June in 2011. Our room number was 2705 and we exchanged in via the Marriott Destination Program on a Thursday-Thursday stay. I'll give you the low-down! The resort: Canyon Villas is an exception resort located on a property that is shared by the JW Marriott Desert Ridge. As a guest at Canyon Villas, you have unrestricted access to the JW, which is AMAZING. A Shuttle bus runs every hour on the hour, but the walk isn't bad at between 5-10 minutes. A good, brief walk before you lounge at the pool is ok! Just stay hydrated. The room: The room is well appointed with a nice water fountain as you enter, full kitchen, dining area, living area, master bedroom suite and an efficiency lock-off. The master bathroom has a tub/vanity combo, as well as a seperate toilet/shower area. The kitchen has a breakfast bar that crosses into the dining area, which includes a full dining table. Pools: Everywhere! There are two main pools in the central resort area, but close to that are smaller spas and other pools. There is a quiet pool at the end of the resort which I frequented, but I am not into the kid thing while I am trying to relax, so, it's cool. The quiet pool is warm, but very refreshing when you get out. There is also a kiddie pool area on the northern side of the resort. The Canyon Springs pool bar is cool...nice people, good food...a little overprices for a pool bar, but well, ya know how it is. Fire pits were located around the property in the pool areas for after hours enjoyment. Sometimes you had to deal with the family smores-a-thon as an evening way to entertain the children, but once that cleared out you can sit by the fire and stare at the stars, which is awesome. Resort Grounds: Impeccably maintained. There are grills in the main resort area, and inbetween a set of buildings on both sides of the property. Near the grills on the south side of the property there is a nice herb garden where you can pick some herbs to accent your dishes...a nice and simple touch. Fitness: Two nice fitness rooms on either side of the main lobby, one for cardio and one for weights. The weight machines were good, but somewhat limiting. Dumbbells up to 50lbs. Remember though, you also have access to the JW weight room, which is a short warm-up run away. At the JW, the weight room has older equipment, but a little more variety, including a Smith Machine, which was good to switch it up. I used both and it worked out ok. All the cardio equip was relatively new and state of the art. There are tennis courts on the grounds as well. Location: Literally at the edge of the desert, which was great. You aren't in the downtown Phoenix area, yet you have access to the Desert Ridge Marketplace, Scottsdale, etc. We found it to be extremely convenient. Originally, we had toyed with the idea of staying in Sedona, but am extremely happy it worked out this way. Sedone is less than a two hour drive, and is perfect for a day trip, or a two-day trip. Anything more than that, I think I'd get red-rocked out. There is much more culture, fine dining, and things to do in the greater phoenix/scottsdale/glendale area...so, this resort location gives you access to it all. Room location: If your goal is to relax and enjoy vacation, try to shoot for a room facing the Golf Course on the second or third floor. We loved the location of our room, but it was on the first floor, which was fine for the beginning of our stay. But, on Sunday, new tenants moved in down the hall and they seemed to want to use the back of the villa as their access to the pool, which is weird because that is where you bedroom is, your private patio, etc. The back is the part that looks onto the golf course (if that is your room view) and it has a large dividing area of plants, rocks, and dirt to seperate it. So, it's nice to look out the door and stare, or sit out on the patio in the morning with coffee...which is why it was so ODD for people to use the back of the villa...it was kind of unsettling. We said something to them, but they were a little thick. Odd, given that they can just go out the front door and take the real hallways to the same location and not have to walk through rocks and plants. So, long story, but it helped remind me of the need for a second or third story room. The JW: This resort is amazing and beautiful. What's truly awesome about this is that you get the beauty and spaciouness of the villa...but, the beauty and grandeur of the JW. This answers some of the indulgent needs of the timeshare traveler! The JW has large and expansive pools, including a lazy river. There is TONS of space to lounge in the sun. The lobby area is huge and has tons of couches to sit out at overlooking the pond. There are fire pits everywhere for at night, and tons of space outside and inside to sit around, and that's not including within the pool area. There are multiple restaurants on site at the JW. Blue Sage is typical American fare, including a buffet breakfast, moderately (resort) priced food. We took a chocolate class here with one of the head-chefs which was awesome...look for it on Sat morning. $39 includes breakfast, class, and take homes!. Roys was by far our favorite, most notably for it's daily 4-6 happy hour where martinis, wine, and select appetizers are only $5 per. Outdoor seating, live music on Fri/Sat...this was the place to be!!! Roy's is hawaiian fusion cuisine and everything was amazing. Try the Hawaiian martini! In addition, there is an italian restaurant (didn't go...desert doesn't say italian to me, but it looked nice). There is also a great-looking steakhouse in the clubhouse to the golf course on the same property...didn't go, but looked amazing. There is a pool bar and a poolside taco bar. The pool bar service was nice...there were always employees working the pool side lounges asking for drinks and food. Try the Kokopelli drink...it's awesome. Was a little disappointed that there weren't any drink specials...but, it was the JW, and I had to adjust my brain. The JW includes Revive Spa which has full spa services (for a fee), a private gym (addt'l fee) and a restaurant. We saw Segway tours that toured the grounds leaving from there as well ($$). Overall, the Canyon Villas/JW combo is a one-two punch knockout. It gave you the spaciousness of villa living as well as the opulence of JW life. The location provided amazing vistas as well as accessibility to Scottsdale and other Phoenix area attractions. The grand canyon was a bit too far, but won't be on the next trip...there was just too much to do and didn't want to not be around the pool another day...especially since I know we'll be back in the Valley of the Sun at the Canyon Villas soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mozo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent time here for a quick getaway. I am very glad we are owners at this property. The property is well kept up and showed well. Loved the spool next to the 2300 Building and we will be back in September for another week.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Marriott Canyon Villas”
Reviews.Author: PennStateFan
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Canyon Villas with 4 people in the 1 BR condo. We had mom and dad in the master room and two kids (8 and 5) share the pull out sofa. We had the 1BR lockoff unit, so it had the master bath, full living room, dining table and kitchen. Loved the space, it's great to spread out. We stayed at a building next to the main pool, so it was nice and easy to get to and from the main pool. We loved the pool area, two pools and the kids loved the basketball hoop in the pool and the waterfall. It was a little chaotic with kids jumping off the walkway and try and dunk the basketball. But over a week, no one go hurt, so that is good. Loved the air hockey, ping pool, pool tablel and big outdoor checkers/chess set. The pool grill did a good job with a basic menu at reasonable prices. Like the location and being able to use the JW facilities next door. Would recommend a car for the area though. There is a shuttle to the JW and a big shopping mall with plenty of dining choices, but it was nice to drive a little too to go outside the area. Two golf courses on property and some upscale restaurants at the JW. Loved the staff, cleanliness and space. Highly recommending the Canyon Villas

Reviews.Title: “Loved the villas!”
Reviews.Author: crjask
Reviews.Content: We traded our studio in Orlando for a studio in Phoenix. We were very pleased with everything. Had a great unit on the 3rd floor with a wonderful view of the golf course and the mountains beyond. I was afraid the temperatures would be too hot but 90 degrees in Phoenix and 90 degrees in Philadelphia are very different. The nights were cool and the days always had a nice breeze. The things I liked about the villas were the proximity to the JW Marriott and the CV staff. Everyone was very helpful and pleasant. We signed up for a hike at Pinnacle Peak and even though we were the only 2 to sign up, they still had a van drive us over and pick us up. Great way to start a morning. The JW was great. We had dinner there several times trying all the restaurants and enjoyed the live music there each evening. The lazy river pool was a great way to spend an afternoon. I would definitely recommend the Canyon Villas and we will be back. I actually thought that the even though the JW had the 4 restaurants, golf, spa, pools, and live entertainment, the guests at the Canyon Villas had the best deal with the size of their accommodations, kitchens, yet full use of all the JW amenities. Great job Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, wonderful experienxe”
Reviews.Author: silverush000
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our time at this wonderful, scenic and comfortable location. No real criticisms, just a great place. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and hot”
Reviews.Author: Snoebunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed last June for a week as exchange though interval international, big resort and although it was full, it never seemed crowded. Plenty of parking, we had a car and Harley, and location is great for day trips. Shopping mall across road is great (I am Canadian and can't get enough of DSW). We had a 1 bedroom unit and it. was clean and comfortable. Our unit was close to Tatum blvd but did not notice any excessive noise. Shuttle bus to jw Marriott was convenient, beautiful hotel, great restaurants and fun lazy river. We exchange our timeshare frequently in US and Europe and this Was one of our top picks. We would absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Location And Staff”
Reviews.Author: hawking
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a two bedroom villa that was spacious clean and well apointed. Great views of the golf course and the pool. Great pool bar with very good prices. Two fine golf courses on site as well as access to Marriott Desert Ridge next door. Lots of planed events and excursions to chose from. Free shuttle service to Desert Ridge (shops and restaurants) across the street. City North, a development, also across the street with even more shops, restaurants, and nightlife. An excellent location, so much so that you can do without a rantal car. Take the Super Shuttle from Sky Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: StitchesToo
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at the Canyon Villas. We had a 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen. It was spacious, comfortable and attractive. There were two flat screen tvs, a washer and dryer and a nice patio. Plenty of closet and drawer space. A large dining table as well as a breakfast bar. Free high speed wireless internet. The bathroom had two vanity areas, a separate shower and large soaking tub. The shower was large, but I wish it included a ledge or seat that would make it easier for ladies to shave. The shower head had two settings and I didn't like either of them. Maybe the one in our room was broken. However, the water pressure was fine. The sound-proofing between rooms could be improved. It wasn't a problem for me, but I will mention it for people who might be more sensitive. We had a first floor unit and could hear people walking above us and also could hear the person next door sneeze quite often....must have been allergies :). The grounds are lovely. There are several pools. We used the main pool and loved it. The water temperature was absolutely perfect. The surrounding area includes a nice outdoor mall including lots of shops, restaurants, etc. Also, Marriott's Desert Ridge Resort is next door and privileges at their facilities are included and a shuttle runs between the two places.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for a While”
Reviews.Author: Cycleboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week at the Canyon Villas and were sad to leave. Everything about the place made it a great place to stay for an extended period of time. The facilities were top notch (pool, fitness center) there were plenty of scheduled activities for guests, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. You do get full use of the facilities at the adjacent J.W. Marriott, but we never felt the need to go there, all our needs were met at the Canyon Villas. It is located in northern Phoenix, about 30 minutes drive from the airport, you definitely need a car if you want to go explore the Phoenix area. There is a great shopping/entertainment center right across the street with multiple restaurants, a movie theater with IMAX and plenty of stores including an Albertsons. We had a one bedroom King suite overlooking the main pool. Very roomy with a complete kitchen so we were able to save some money by eating in a couple of nights and having breakfast every day. There was a nice patio where we would have coffee in the morning and soak up the sun. The bathroom was nice with a big walk-in shower and a separate soaker tub. Bedroom had a comfortable king sized bed and a flat screen TV and DVD player (same in the living room), one plus is that they also had HD channels available... Overall we would strongly recommend this place and we liked it so much that we are thinking of purchasing a membership in the Marriott Vacation Club.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful location for a great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: surfinginflorida
Reviews.Content: I bought a getaway here for a week from Interval International. It is just my husband and I, but I think this would be a great place for kids. We were given a third floor room near the main pool area. It is really nice because they have several different pool areas so the courtyards between buildings are nice. For little kids there is a pool area and playground, for bigger kids the main pool area has water sports as well as pool, ping-pong, and foosball. The grounds are beautiful and well kept; there are several sidewalks for walking, and a fantastic outdoor shopping mall is only a ten-minute walk. Also, the JW Marriott is a short walk, and it provides access to additional amenities and restaurants. I’ve seen lots of wildlife on my walks – but no rattlesnakes yet! Unfortunately, the lazy river was closed for maintenance during our visit. The Marriott has two great golf courses, several tennis courts, etc. The problem is that there is TOO much to do here! The resort schedules activiities all day long that you can participate in if you have some extra time. I did the hike and the trip to the botanical gardens. The rooms..We booked a lock-off, so it was just an efficiency. The room was comfortable, and having the big balcony was a huge plus because it gave us a place to have breakfast and lunch. With just a microwave and fridge, we went out to dinner at night. The kitchen area was a little cramped compared to other resorts because of a door for an air conditioner or hot water heater. No dishwasher, and we were only provided dish service for two (normally in an efficiency it is for four). No washer and dryer, however, they had full size commercials and dryers in a nearby building (complementary). The bed was very comfortable. Surprisingly, the towels were very worn – ours had rips and snags, not something I would expect from a Marriott. Happy hour at the JW is lots of fun – tiki torches, outdoor heaters and fireplaces, comfortable seating outdoors – and great drinks and appetizers! Try Roy’s from 4-6. Be aware that the "business center" costs 35 cents per minute, yikes! The front desk will print boarding passes etc. for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: bouldertraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Canyon Villas on the resort property. Very welcoming, informative of amenities. Room was nice sized with seating area and great balcony with cafe set for coffee and views. Clean, comfortable bedding. Hope to go again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Solid and nice place to stay for a few days...”
Reviews.Author: Meerkat92101
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a week here. The rooms were on par with the JW Mariott across the street, plus you have a massive kitchen with an island. The master suite was beautiful and had a large tub. The pools and amenities were standard, but the fact you can stay here and then walk across the street to enjoy what the JW hotel offers - made this a sweetheart deal. Beds were luxurious and if you are into social events at your site - this place has a lot of them. We enjoyed a wine mixer which was fun. The outdoor grills work great and I can only say that I'd stay here again if I had the chance. This hotel is located in Northern Phoenix, but very close to a large outdoor mall that has every kind of food and shopping you 'd need. FYI - the A/C works great here.

Reviews.Title: “Still a wonderful choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyage555
Reviews.Content: We are owners here and it is still our favorite of the seven Marriott weeks we own. There were some housekeeping issues this time but they were addressed promptly and efficiently. We reccommend this resort to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Marriott hotel, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: JCMass
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Phoenix this weekend, and throughly enjoyed our stay at the Canyon Villa's. We were there from Wednesday thru Saturday, and stayed in the two room villa. It felt like home quickly and we really appreciated the amenities like a washer and dryer in the unit. We were able to pack less clothing, a real plus. We found the rooms very comfortable, and quite large. The balcony was also quite large. The staff were very helpful, and the place is very welcoming. Parking at the Villa's is included, and so is Wi Fi if you bring your computer. Both of these are an extra charge at the hotel. There is a free shuttle to the hotel twice every hour, and we were given a parking pass and a key to get into the extensive pool area there. You could walk over in about 15 minutes, but the hear made us think twice about it, and we drove ourselves and took the shuttle other times. We ate at the main hotel, and were able to charge the bill to our rooms at the Villa's. The pool area at the Villa's is very large, and this time of year it was quiet and not crowded at all. The have a collection of books you can borrow, or add to, plenty of ice water at the pool, and activites that go on like a movie some nights, and other's music. One night we did star gazing with a gentleman who had a huge telescope, and lots of information about the stars. The location is excellent for visiting the Phoenix area. The large shopping complex across the street has everything including an excellent grocery store. The whole complex is huge, and beautiful, I hope to go back again some time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SWGoodSam
Reviews.Content: We visited the last week in August, a low spot in the year. During the week it felt like we were living in a Ghost Town, we heard very little noise from other guests. The 2 Room Condo was extremely spacious, beautifully appointed and furnishings all in good order. It felt a little sparse in the kitchen implements, but we were able to get along with what was available. Our unit faced the Childrens pool with Frog Waterfall. We enjoyed the sound of the waterfall so much we slept with the window open to hear it all night. Again, in the low season we saw very few people even use that pool. Movie night at the Main pool allowed us to watch the movie while sitting IN the pool, which we thought was a unique experience. We specifically choose Canyon Villas for the JW Marriott Lazy River. It is beautiful and we were not disappointed. To get there we had to drive to the Canyon Villas reception area and wait for the shuttle. During our waits, we found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. (Thanks you Sharon) The free Ice water available everywhere (Canyon Villas and Marriott) was perfect. The only possible downside was transit time to the JW Marriott. After a couple of days I realized that we were spending at least an hour of our precious vacation, each time we visited the 'other side'. And parking at the JW Marriott was Valet or a 1/4 mile hike from self parking, neither of which was attractive to us. We found shopping for groceries to be super convenient, literally just down the street. We felt very much at home and will hopefully return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation - usual high Marriott standard”
Reviews.Author: FERG12
Reviews.Content: We chose this purely because we could do a timeshare exchange for the Phoenix area and we knew what standard we would get with Marriott. It suited us perfectly and we'd go back with no hesitation. Located in the 'Desert Ridge' area in Northeast Phoenix, it's very close to the main routes to downtown Phoenix, Scottsdale and surrounding areas and there's an excellent outdoor Mall with a good choice of restaurants on your doorstep - Desert Ridge Marketplace.
