The 'resort' consists of the Marriott Canyon villas (the timeshare complex), the JW Marriott hotel (5* I believe the biggest resort hotel in Arizona) and Wildfire Golf Club. In cooler months I guess you can walk between them (15/20 mins) but in July we chose our air conditioned car! There's more development planned for the general vicinity but I believe the recession hit hard in 2008 and halted development in it's tracks. We liked the pool at the villas. The pool bar staff were very friendly and helpful, providing tips for restaurants etc. We also spent a morning using the pools at the JW. The grounds are beautiful, so well maintained with a great choice of pools and a lazy river. Despite being there 4th of July weekend it didn't seem over crowded, despite it's size and sunbeds were plentiful. Staff will bring you large jugs of iced water to your sunbed etc and wait on you poolside. Excellent service. We also used the fitness room. It's not huge but, while I would have loved to have run outdoors, it just wasn't practical in July so it allowed me to try to burn off some of the calories I was packing away at dinner every night! It proved to be a great base for our 4 night stay in the area as part of a longer trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful "Villa" Property”
Reviews.Author: Da11asGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Canyon Villas on our way to Sedona and stayed in a 2 bedroom with balcony which looked out to the desert and mountains. Beds were extremely comfortable, marble baths, great kitchen and all the items needed for a longer stay. Felt like you were in the middle of the desert but actually in the middle of North Phoenix within 5 min access to great restaurants and shopping. Grocery and liquor stores as well! Excellent base to venture out and explore all that Phoenix and the surrounding areas have to offer. The grounds around the property were lovely...this is the "villa" area of JW Marriott Desert Ridge Resort & Spa and you have access to their amenities. Since we were only there one night we didn't have time to take advantage of. Planning to return in the next few months!

Reviews.Title: “If you golf, this is the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: wpmchesternj
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Vacation Club owners and love to stay at the chain when we travel. I was able to purchase a Getaway week through Interval International at the Canyon Villas for a very reasonable rate and we used the Resort as a base to explore the Phoenix area. We have never been to AZ and were able to easily drive to Williams and the Grand Canyon, Sedona and Tucson to the south. The resort is what you would expect from Marriott. And if I was a golfer............ Clean, well maintained and Marriott. You also get to use the amenities at the neighboring JW Marriott including the lazy river pool. The transportation is complimentary. Canyon Villas has a poolside grill restaurant (normal for MVC resorts). JW Marriott hotel has several upscale restaurants with happy hour specials that moderate the cost. We were very close to the Phoenix Zoo and Chase Field where we attended a major league game. To be fair, I reiterate that I am a Marriott Vacation Club owner in Aruba and Hawaii so I am partial to MVC locations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: BevRostelle
Reviews.Content: The trip in July was hot as hades but the 2 bedroom villas were fantastic for our family with 2 teenagers! We had the newer units and they were very nice! Very roomy, nice kitchen, 2 separate beds (I think queensize) for the 2nd room. Master bedroom as nice as expected with king bed, patio, separate shower tub, closets, etc. The only negative was that we had noisy kids running and jumping above us so I would ask for the 3rd floor if we come back. The villas have nice fitness rooms separated weight and cardio rooms, beautiful pool and snack bar. The JW Marriott hotel is just across the way so we played tennis one morning ( $20 hr nice courts) and tried out the lazy river and pools over there. To be honest, I thought the pool was nicer at the villas (less crowded) but the snack bar by the JW Marriott hotel is much better. Yummy smoothies! My husband and I ate at Roy's Hawaiian Grill Restaurant and it was delicious for dinner with nice ambiance. Grounds at the hotel are beautiful. Didn't try the spa but heard it's great (pricey). Close to shopping, fast food, grocery, etc. Would definitely come back here!!

Reviews.Title: “3 Star at Best!”
Reviews.Author: sunbaby39
Reviews.Content: First the BAD! BUGS!! They must not spray for them here. This place was infested with ants. Crawling up walls all over the floors, YUK! I am a Rewards Member with Marriott and specifically asked for a room in a quiet location and they put us in a room right on Tatum Blvd and overlooking the Kiddee pool, So much for quiet. THEN THE GOOD! The good about this property is there rooms, very nice, (except for ants), The JW Marriott is right next door and has a lazy river pool which is nice on these hot summer days. This resort is great for families with small children. The Canyon Villas are not close to anything, 15 minutes to Scottsdale, 25 Minutes to Tempe or Mesa. The shuttle bus to the JW is every 30 minutes or so, Room service is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort and home-base for the Arizona Experience”
Reviews.Author: Fijalclarkski
Reviews.Content: My parents traded one of their east coast timeshare weeks for a week at the Canyon Villas, and they invited my wife and I to join them in a 2-bedroom villa. We had a fantastic week full of swimming, sunbathing, and eating, peppered with day-trips to the Grand Canyon and Sedona. I'll break my review into sections. THE ROOM: We had a 2-bedroom villa in building 3400, which is the northernmost building, though still not too far from the front desk and the main pool. The villa is nicely decorated and is spacious enough to host guests. Each bedroom is large and features a large (37"?) flat screen TV. My wife and I were in the second bedroom and had our own balcony/lanai overlooking the kids splash pool. We also had a separate entrance and small kitchenette area. Overall the room was great for us. If you prefer a quieter location, ask to be placed in a room on the southern end of the resort to be away from the road and the kids pool. CANYON VILLA AMENITIES: The resort had plenty to do, in addition to being a beautiful place for a nice walk. We spent a lot of time by the main pools. There were a lot of kids who were generally well-behaved, but there was still enough room to move around and snag a good lounge chair. There are two areas where lounges are placed under misters. Much to my surprise, they don't get you that wet, so you can read a book under them while enjoying what feels like AC! I wasn't impressed by the food at the Canyon Springs bar, but it was decent (and the staff was friendly). We also took advantage of the well-appointed fitness center, which has a good variety of new machines. Confusingly, however, the cardio and weight rooms are adjacent to one another, but you have to go outside (and use your key card) to pass between them. We also attended a yoga class led by a human instructor one day (on other days, yoga is led by a DVD!). We also made use of the grills distributed throughout the property. There are many more amenities but we didn't take advantage of them. JW MARRIOTT AMENITIES: We often walked over to the JW Marriott across the street (we never were able to catch the shuttle - it's a short walk anyway) to use the pools and to dine out. The pool area is very nice - who can resist a lazy river? We liked the nearby serpentine pool because it was quieter and offered natural shade from trees. The pool area restaurant at the JW was much better than at the Canyon Villas. There is chair-side food and beverage service there too. Just be sure to ask for a full menu when they come by - the laminated sheet they distribute has a fraction of what is offered at the restaurant. Roy's Hawaiian Fusion restaurant has "Aloha Hour" with drink specials and appetizers for $5 each - quite a deal. In my opinion, you can skip all the other appetizers and order the sliders - they're incredible and the sweet potato fries they come with are really tasty! Great staff there too. We also had dessert only at Meritage, the steakhouse at the JW. The restaurant was mostly empty and service was awkward, but it was nice nonetheless. The decor is nice but I am always weirded out by cowhide (fake or not), which adorns the chairbacks. We attended the stargazing event at the JW one night. There were a lot of kids with parents that were more interested in seeing Saturn than keeping their kids from throwing pebbles at ducks. It basically turned into a kid's program, so we left (after having seen Saturn, of course!). OUTSIDE THE RESORT: The Desert Ridge Marketplace is down the road and offers a bunch of restaurants and shops. Sadly, most of them are found in every other shopping center in America (CPK, Rock Bottom, Macaroni Grill, TGI Friday's, etc.). There is also an In-n-Out Burger which I indulged in (animal style!). Upon check-in, the Canyon Villas provides a coupon book for various stores and restaurants at the marketplace. We used 4-5 of these coupons and saved a bit of money. Sedona is a 2-hour drive and the Grand Canyon is four hours away. We visited Montezuma's Castle and drove through Sedona on our way to the Canyon, where we spent one night at a cheapo hotel in order to get more time seeing the world's largest hole. Sedona was worth a second trip, where we took (and thoroughly enjoyed) a Pink Jeep tour. On our last night we drive through Scottsdale. We wish we had thought of it sooner - we would have spent more time in downtown Scottsdale if we could have. Overall, it was a fantastic vacation made more fantastic by our stay at the Villas. We highly recommend it for anyone, especially families with children. We may be back someday with little ones of our own!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: MWsogetthis
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Canyon Villas Resort. We just love it here! The staff has repeatedly been attentive and willing to accommodate our needs. The concierge is a great resource and hasn't steered us wrong yet. The resort grounds are beautiful and well-maintained. There are several pools in the complex, some for children and some for adults, making it ideal for family vacations or quiet weekend getaways. The larger villa rooms are perfect for traveling with families. The rooms are tastefully decorated and large enough to move around in without feeling cramped. Our first visit was spent exclusively on the property and there was more than enough to do. There are activities scheduled at both the Villas resort and the hotel resort daily, so its easy to keep yourself entertained. The resort is situated next to a large shopping center and is easily accessible from a main thoroughfare but still has a secluded, "island" feel. Our second trip was spent exploring the area. We liked the shopping and dining in Scottsdale particularly. The resort is definitely family friendly, but keep in mind there are areas of the complex and activities that might not be. Don't be surprised if you get a few annoyed looks from fellow guests if you stumble into the wrong area with your own brood. Did I mention we love it here?

Reviews.Title: “Resort itself is very nice, but location is too far out”
Reviews.Author: EveAndGreg
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here in the fall, when the weather was about mid-80's every day. This property is very new and modern, and the rooms / units are all five-star quality. The pool complexes are very nice too - but, they were quite crowded every day. The better option is to go across the road to the J.W. Marriott, because you get free access there, and they have huge pools and a lazy river and generally much bigger grounds. The pool restaurant is suprisingly good. At least half the people staying here have kids, so it's family friendly. The location is way north in Phoenix though, it's literally out in the desert. While it's scenic, if you want to go to Scottsdale or go tour or golf or whatever somewhere that isn't north, it's going to take a while. There are restaurants and stores in the area, as it appears that the city is creeping out that way, but all the shopping centers are new and bland and feel like some kind of exurban photocopy. Wasn't able to golf so can't comment on the course other than that it looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place”
Reviews.Author: picasso_coco
Reviews.Content: We have traveld a lot with out Marriott timeshare and none so far compares to the excellency of the Canyon Villas. We have spent a very leasurely and relaxed week in the abolutely clean (and I am very picky about that) and newly furnished apartment on the ground floor. There is even a water fountain installed in the wall to keep the dryness of the air moderate. Between the building complexes there is a big garden space which makes the villa patio very private. We enjoyed cooking with the fresh herbs growing right outside the patio and they have every imaginable herb. There are BBQs right out to the left, close enough to take our food there easily but far enough off to not be bothered by other BBQers. To the pool areas it was a short nice walk through the garden and were luckily either to the left or the right side of the apartment. There is a quiet spool (huge hot tub but not as hot as a real hot tub). Behind the reception is the main pool area with a big nice temperatured pool with a water fall and 2 hot tubs with one water fall each plus a little lap pool. If this is not enough you can take a shuttle to the adjacent Marriott Hotel and use all the amenities there. We took the car over and some just walked through the golf course. The hotel is very tranquil, especially the outside setting with the Hawaiian restaurant and pretty pond is great for a cocktail in the evening. The pool area doesn't look big at first sight but opens up to different levels and curves around the property. This gives you much more privacy. Behind the pool is another lovely pond which has a great view over the golf corse and to the mountains. The lazy river with the free tubes are great for kids and adults as well. Floating by and watching birds, ducks and bunnies. The jack rabbits are all over and just so cute! The pools have all different temperatures from warm to hot. So no freezing anywhere around your belly line when getting in, which I loved! Right next to the Marriott properties is a mall which offers the big name stores but also has an outside pedestrian type shopping area too. There is a little place there with a water fountain where kids can get in and play. To be crazy enough they turn on a huge outside fire place despite 90°F just for the looks of it. Go there it's great! Who needs the Grand Canyon, if you can stay at Canyon Villas?

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: JASUAS
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter (20 years old) and a couple of friends travel to Phoenix for the first time in May. We stayed a week at the Marriott Canyon villa's which we picked up for a very good price through Interval Int. We arranged transportation from the airport through the resort. I believe the outfit was called Destinations, driver was Todd. Very clean vehicle and more reasonably priced that a cab or limo service. We own at a Marriott timeshare in Myrtle Beach and this resort although set up slightly different, is very nice. We stayed in the two bedroom unit, while our friends were in a lock off efficiency unit. The two bedroom unit is furnished very well. Beds are exceptional, plenty of living space, dishes, washer/dryer which come in handy, 3 tV's, kitchen with appliances. Set up is similar to our timeshare in MB. The lock off is fairly small, but worked fine for two people with a king bed, couch and small fridge, coffee maker. All units have decks. We were in a 3rd floor unit in bldg 2700 overlooking the pool. A couple of units overlooked the golf course, others didn't have too much of a view. The activities at the resort worked out well for us. We played the two golf courses on site, both were in very good shape, alot of traps but fair off the tee and fairly large greens. We lounged by the pool several afternoons, never had a problem finding a chair. The pool bar is a good place to get a lunch and a cold beverage or two! Beverage manager Matt is top notch. My wife and daughter took advantage of the Spa at the JW Marriott a couple of times while I was golfing, and they said it was heavenly. We took one day trip through Detours to the Grand Canyon. Picked us up a 7Am returned at 7PM. Fairly expensive but definetly worth it. Don't get sold on only going as far as Sedona (beautiful red rocks), but nothing compared to the grand canyon. We ate out most everynight. The desert ridge mall is within a mile and offers several resturants and shopping. The KEG was a good steakhouse, reasonably priced and the Yard house offered about as many different beers as I have ever seen. TGIF, Maraconi Grill were also good. Went into Scottsdale one night to the Capital Grill, very good food and environment but overpriced compared to some we've been to. We went over to the JW a couple of times during the week. Only about a 10 minute walk and a shuttle is offered at times but we never seemed to match up. The JW is outstanding. The grounds, pool, spa are all top notch. Ate at Raye's, which was very good. The one thing we found a little dissappointing at the Canyon villa's was the market place. Only the necessities, very small. Really had to go the JW or mall if you needed anything. Overall we really enjoyed our trip to Phoenix and the Cannon Villa's. I'd recomend it to anyone with small children to retirees that are just looking to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at it's best”
Reviews.Author: ebonywoman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Phoenix for my nephew's graduation and decided to make it a vacation also. Well, all I can say is that we plan to make this an annual trip. We loved staying at the villas, we had a 1 bedroom. Our villa was clean, comfortable, well equipped kitchen. It was nice to have breakfast on the balcony in the morning. Big comfortable bed, furniture was comfortable also for relaxing. nice soaking bathtub separate shower, 2 sinks (one in the bathroom and one where the bathtub is beside the bathroom). The villas were roomy. The service was great anything we needed we called and it was there in a jiffy. We had a rented car and only moved it twice the whole week. Everything is right there for you. The J.W. Marriott is adjacent to the villas. We had access to all of the amenities over there. They have stores inside the hotel. a Starbucks, many restaurants to choose from, about 1/2 dozen pools to choose from including a lazy river. They even had a Nickelodeon show for the kids. The scenery is unbelievable. The only thing I can tell you is you have to go and experience it for yourself. It's really hard to appreciate it unless you experience it. You won't be disappointed. Oh and the shopping center, stores galore (also an Albertson's for groceries) all kinds of restaurants. something for every budget. I know I'm going on and on but there is so much to tell about this place. I hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Come for the Resort”
Reviews.Author: jonathanhsinger
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Canyon Villas as a way to enjoy all the great amenities of the JW Marriott Desert Ridge -- staying at the villas gives one full access to the main hotel, which is just a short walk or shuttle ride away -- without having to pay quite as much for one's stay. The hotel has a plethora of pools and hot tubs, as well as the hotels and lazy river at the main resort. My only complaint was that the positioning of the air conditioning vent, pointing directly at the bed, made it slightly more difficult to sleep comfortably at night. Nevertheless, I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot in Scottsdale Area”
Reviews.Author: Espresso17
Reviews.Content: This Vacation club community is great. We spent a lot of time both at this property, and at the connected JW Marriott resort. It was an easy, and enjoyable walk. We stayed in a 1 bedroom with a Kitchen. There is an outdoor mall about a mile away - again very walkable with a stroller. Everything was in like new condition. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Business”
Reviews.Author: jim9013
Reviews.Content: I must confess I do not usually write on Trip Advisor, but feel a sense of obligation given the overwhelming positive reviews on this property. I do not recommend this property for business travelers. This is a Marriott Vacation Club resort and should not be confused with regular Marriott quality. This is not a place for business people. The room I was was put into, at $409 per night, was an absolute disaster. small, cramped, tired carpeting, noisy and no desk. It was a "lock-off" of a main unit...nothing better then a small bedroom with functional bath. I was able (with much hassle) to move across the road to a much better room in the adjacent JW Marriott. At a lower rate...no contest. Business Traveller Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: looking4sun09
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place! Great layout, the rooms were gorgeous, pools amazing!! Loved every part of our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...Been Going for 5 Years”
Reviews.Author: alexsndiego
Reviews.Content: We love Canyon Villas! We have been owners for 5 years now and every year we go. We have thought about banking or trading in our weeks but every time we stay here, we love it. The rooms are kept in great condition. They recently upgraded some rooms with flat screens, new carpet, new upholstery and paint. What separates this property from other time shares is the staff. The pool bar staff is outstanding. Matt and Jonalynn provide the best service and always have a smile on their faces. Matt and Jonalynn make our stay in like we are staying with family. The service at the Canyon Villas pool bar exceeds that of the JW. We stopped going to the JW pool bar about 2 years ago. The pool is great. The property also has a mini water park for kids, quiet pool, and steam sauna. The gym was recently upgraded with new cardio equipment. Each cardio equipment now has it own TV and iPod hook up. Front desk staff great. Grounds are kept really clean and integrated with the "desert" environment. We always visit the Revive spa at the JW and are always happy with the level of service and professionalism. The spa has great amenities such as wet and dry sauna, indoor jacuzzi, private indoor shower, semi-private outdoor showers, private outdoor sunning area in each gender's locker room. Towels and robes provided. Locker room attendants are quick cleaning up making the locker room immaculate. The spa pool is very relaxing and food at the Spa Bistro is really good also. We had the blackened cod and it was very tasty. We can't imagine a year without vacationing at Canyon Villas!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a 2 bedroom condo”
Reviews.Author: Steveh3Texas
Reviews.Content: We are Frog fans and stayed here for the Fiesta Bowl. We got a great deal on the Marriott web site for a 2 bedroom which easily slept the 5 of us. Of course, as renters we did not have a great view out of the window but we didn't expect much. The resort is near the JW Marriott but we didn't use the JW's facilities except my wife used the spa. The pools at the condos are nice and the location is convenient for getting around Scotsdale as well as north Phoenix. My family did a lot of shopping and my wife and I took the trail to the top of Camelback Mountain. All good. We played golf at the TPC Stadium course and at the Marriott's Faldo course. Virtually no one on the Faldo course and very good rates!

Reviews.Title: “Room next to busy highway”
Reviews.Author: Yogibear_10
Reviews.Content: We booked this for our last two nights in AZ after a fabulous driving holiday. We had previously had a good experience at the Newport Coast Villas in CA, marred only by the proximity of our room to the highway. We were dismayed to arrive at the Canyon Villas via a very busy road only to find we had been placed in a block overlooking it at the outer reaches of the property - is this company policy for non-timeshare guests? We arrived at dusk and the communal landings/stairways were dark/uninviting and the reception and pool areas were not as well appointed as the Newport Coast property. The receptionist did not seem to understand our concerns although she did, at our request, check availability at the Marriott Desert Ridge - the conference hotel forming part of the same complex -where we spent an enjoyable end to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this vacation.”
Reviews.Author: DebbieB56
Reviews.Content: We have a Marriott timeshare in Orlando, and all the Marriott timeshares we've been to are excellent. Roomy, comfy, well-equipped. What I loved about this one is that you're able to use the JW Marriott resort across the way which is gorgeous! A shuttle runs every 30 minutes to take you over. (It's not a far walk if you can stand the heat.) We loved relaxing in the lazy river and playing in the pools. We went horseback riding through the desert while we were there and spent two days going to the Grand Canyon. (Research this ahead of time--we didn't and stayed at a "resort" which was awful. Since it was only for one night, I busted out laughing, it was so bad. If it had been for longer, we would have gone elsewhere.) Having never been to AZ, we loved seeing desert and the Grand Canyon and thought being able to use the resort made this a great value. I would have given it 5 stars for cleanliness, as it appeared spotless, but one night I saw a roach in the bathroom. Eeek! Maybe that's normal for hot climates, but not for a northern city girl. Still, I'd go back. It would be a great Girls Trip with the Spa at the JW.

Reviews.Title: “Alittle bit of paradise”
Reviews.Author: MGD828
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week and had a great time with the kids. Yes you can swim in December in Phoenix. The Villas were nice, very comfortable, with a great kitchen. If you want more in the way of activities and expenses you can use the J W Marriott across the street. The drinks were twice the price but the lazy river and other pools were great.

Reviews.Title: “THE PLACE TO BE FOR VACATION WITH FAMILY”
Reviews.Author: Chefsaba
Reviews.Content: AWSOME AWSOME AWSOME RESORT. The rooms were great, the pool was wonderful and the staff did everything to take care of all of our requests such as rooms in the same building and on the top floor. If you are looking for a great family vacation, Marriott Canyon should be on the top of your list.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: OaklandJeff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Canyon Villas for a week as part of a group of several families with young children. Our experience was mixed. Pros: - Very spacious, attractive, well-appointed suites at reasonable rates. We were able to host a dinner for 8 adults and 6 kids in our suite by using all of the tables and chairs provided. - For kids, there is a small playground, a shallow splash pool, and a large 3.5-foot-deep pool at the resort. - Access to the JW Marriott next door (long walk or short drive) with its "lazy river" pool, Roy's restaurant, and very attractive grounds. - Big shopping center across the street has a supermarket, Target, and many other shops and restaurants. - Half an hour drive away from downtown Phoenix and the airport, museums, zoo, Desert Botanical Garden, etc. Cons: - The buildings are very densely packed on the property. The 3300 building, where we stayed, is very close to a busy four-lane road. Most of the time we couldn't hear the noise inside our suite, but when we stepped outside it was very noticeable. As I walked from one building to another or to the pools, I was very aware of the housing development just a few dozen yards away, and of the fairly massive resort buildings packed fairly close together. The net result for me was that it was missing that "away from it all" feeling that I typically get in a high-end resort. - I could not get the climate control to work correctly. I like to keep the fan on to keep the air circulating. In both of our rooms, if the fan was on, so was the AC, and the room kept getting colder. In other words, there was no way to run the fan without also cooling the room. Eventually it would get too cold (much colder than the thermostat was set for, and the only solution was to switch the unit off. - There were bright spots (engineering was super prompt and helpful when we had some minor issues with the rooms), but overall service was mediocre. As one example, two days in a row the supply of towels at the main pool ran out. I can see this happening once, but twice in a row indicates someone's not trained or not doing their job. - The playground and splash pool are far from the main pool. So if you have toddlers on the playground or in the splash pool, and other kids or adults in the main pool, the groups are not going to be interacting.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, not quite great”
Reviews.Author: Nate-7
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 travelled to the Marriott Canyon Villas for a one week stay in mid-October. We had a 1 bedroom with a full kitchen, dining room and living room. The resort accommodated my request (left a voice mail message a week before our arrival) to have a top floor room. We enjoyed the top floor room as there was no noise from 'loud walkers' up above. However, the balcony for our room overlooked a rather boring courtyard and faced another set of villas so there was no real view and little privacy. The villa itself was very nicely laid out and we had plenty of room for 2 adults and 2 young childre. The villa was well stocked, was clean, and everything was in working order. We only spent 1 day at the villa pools and our kids were bored because there was no waterslide or lazy river. Therefore, we spent the other days at the JW Marriott across the road (it is easy walking distance for adults but the kids complained about the long walk so we generally took the free shuttle bus back and forth between the JW and the Canyon Villas). The shuttle ran on time and the drivers were courteous. The JW resort is beautiful and has a few very nice pools with something for everyone including families as there is a very nice area to lay out in reclining chairs and be able to watch your kids on the waterslide. We did not eat at the villas pool restaurant but we did eat a few times at the JW pools (wait staff comes around frequently to ask if you need anything). The food was average and prices were reasonable for a resort of this caliber. I would sum it up by saying that the villa was beautiful but the Canyon Villas Resort lacks a little bit as far as kids activities go, and their Marriott Marketplace is the size of closet with no supplies so be prepared to go off-site for a lot of things. We stayed at the Westin Kierland villas in May 2009 and would rate the Kierland 1 star higher than the Marriott. The rooms are very similar, but the Westin Kierland Villas pool area, gym, marketplace, etc, all have a more upscale feel to it. If the Kierland Villas are not available the next time we visit Phoenix, then we would still gladly stay at the Marriott Canyon Villas, however, the Kierland Villas would be our first choice if it was available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool area and comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: TexasAngel63
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Our balcony looked over the pool area. It had a nice waterfall feature. It was a bit cold to swim for my tastes, but it was nice to lay out on one of the many chairs they had there. The beds were very comfortable. We never ate on the property or at the JW Marriott which is adjoining the Villas because the food was pretty pricey. The room we stayed in had a microwave, fridge, sink, and dishes. It was very nice. I loved sitting out on the balcony every morning watching the sun rise over the mountains.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place, not good enough to buy”
Reviews.Author: sparklesque
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a lock-off unit (no full kitchen), and it was fine for two people. I'm glad I didn't trade my Maui unit for this place though, because it wouldn't be worth it. My first big beef with this place was that as soon as I walked in, there was no hotel book in the whole room. By hotel book, I mean the book that gives a map of the hotel, the amenities, the TV channel list, restaurants on-site and in the area, etc. I called the front and asked where it was, and they said they were in process of printing new ones. Not a good excuse. Also, there was no Where magazine in the room, just a permanent hard copy version of the weekly magazine, which is very cheap. I found out at the JW hotel guests though were given a copy of the weekly Where magazine though- the villa guests are not good enough I guess to get this. The vacation club villas were a good 14 minute walk to the main JW Marriott hotel, since our villa was the farthest from the central area. Although I don't mind walking, I found the walkways to be awkward and disjointed, and there were no signs on how to get to the JW. The lighting between the 2 resorts was truly awful- way too dark to be considered safe. There was no "welcome owners" reception, and the activities at the JW were not readily shared with the villa guests. I found out at the JW about a nature walk given on Saturdays at the hotel, and I'm glad I went (it was great), but this wasn't advertised at the villas section. The market pantry was poorly stocked and pretty pathetic, with no decent magazines. Our TV turned itself on and off mysteriously (I think it had a broken touch sensor), and after I told the front desk, she said someone would come and look at it. Nobody ever came. No room tidying was ever done, so I can't speak of the housekeeping. The location was very good, but the resort just isn't good enough to be a true destination. The JW however was very nice, but I felt so separated from it with the lack of signs and lighting. The villa guests seem second rate to the hotel, and I would never buy one of the villas. The shuttle that ran between the two resorts was never useful for us, since I didn't want to stand and wait when I could just walk and get there faster. The spa was excellent and the on-site hotel restaurants were very good. I loved how they had cold water available all around the hotel, villas, and pools. The resort was very nice, with comfy beds, good towels, etc...everything you expect from Marriott. The flair was all at the JW however, but the main pool section at the villas was a good size and had a fun waterfall in the center of the pool. We saw tons of rabbits on the grounds, which was cute, and some interesting birds. We hiked up Camelback Mountain, which was awesome, and I would highly recommend it. It is was strenous though, and you need to be adventurous to do it. We ate the the breakfast restaurant at the JW and at Roys also, they were very good. The villas has no restaurant, but there is a shack at the pool area that serves typical fried food wonders. I though the Phoenix area was wonderful, with a great climate, and beautiful scenery. There are lots of day hikes to do, so it was hard to choose just one due to our time contraints. The airport was only about 20 minutes aways and we didn't encounter any big traffic tie ups. Of the JW wasn't there, this place would be sooo boring.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Canyon Villas - great experience!”
Reviews.Author: chris44Texas
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Marriott Canyon Villas for 3 nights so we could go see the Grand Canyon from there. My mom, 11-year-old daughter, and I stayed in a two bedroom unit, and it was fabulous! The units are furnished very nicely, large flat screen TV's in the living room and both bedrooms, beautiful landscaping throughout the resort, etc. We did go over to the JW Marriott next door to visit the pool and lazy river. The JW is lavish both inside and out, landscaping is fantastic, and there are several ducks wandering around outside - very cute. However, we didn't feel the need to go back again to its pool & lazy river. ( We don't care for lazy rivers where water squirts on your head a few times as you go around.) We actually found it to be more enjoyable at the pool at the Villas. The only drawback to the pool at the Villas is that there is no shade where you have to stand in line to get food and drinks at the pool bar - also no mat to stand on, so if you're in bare feet on the hot concrete, watch out! Another great thing about the JW next door is that we ate at Roy's Hawaiian. I'm a big fan of this restaurant (have eaten previously at the one in Philadelphia), so I made reservations. It happened to be Restaurant Week in Phoenix, so we got a 3-course meal for $29! And most of the seating is outside with wonderful landscaping and tiki torches, so the atmosphere is just wonderful. OK, back to the Villas - not only did we enjoy the condo itself, we also enjoyed going out in the morning just beyond our patio to a large paved area with a waterfall, foliage, gas grills, tables & chairs, and a playground with a slide, which is formed as the tail of a gigantic lizard (or gecko??). There are even pails and shovels in case the kids want to play in the "sand" (it doesn't look like beach sand, but it's sandy-ish). We didn't have a lot of interaction with staff, but they were very responsive if I had a question or needed anything. We had a lightbulb out, and they replaced it within minutes. As previous posters have said, the Desert Ridge Marketplace is very close and has tons of restaurants, shops, movie theater, gas station, etc. - also an Alberton's grocery store so you can stock your fridge. (You can look at website for Desert Ridge Marketplace to see what shops it has.) We don't cook on vacation, but we always get soft drinks, snacks, and breakfast items - we use just the fridge and microwave. Oh and we also used the coffee maker, but we didn't particularly care for the complimentary Yuban coffee - but it was nice that they provided it. Also, daily maid service was provided at no extra charge like at some timeshares. I know there's also a little market shop in the lobby of Villas, but we weren't there long enough to use it, so I can't speak to what it carries. We really enjoyed the covered parking at the villas - keeps your car much cooler. No charge for parking, and there seemed to be plenty of it. The villas were actually pretty full when we were there, even though it was after all kids had gone back to school. They said it was because JW was full and Villas were taking overflow. But it didn't seem crowded at the pool, parking, etc. We enjoyed the misters at the pool, water basketball, and the games around the pool area - air hockey, ping pong, billiards, and the big checkers/chess board on the deck. On this visit, we took the 1-day tour to Grand Canyon with Detours. They picked us up at Villas at 7:30 a.m. and we returned about 9:15 p.m. (a litte behind schedule, not due to anyone's fault). It was a very informative tour, and we even decided to do the optional helicopter tour with Maverick Helicopters at the Grand Canyon. You can get more info at Detours website. We also visited the Heard Museum, which is very nice (AAA has a small discount for this museum). We had lunch at their outdoor cafe - wonderful food and very nice little courtyard area. You can view the menu at the website for Heard Museum. One last bit of info - there's not really a convenient place to get gas close to the airport, but you can gas up your rental car at the Shell station at Desert Ridge Marketplace, and your tank will still show "full" when you return it at airport. Try renting from National - that's where I found the best deals because you can stack contract ID's and coupons. I always get my travel info at Tripadvisor, and I hope this info I've posted will be helpful to you!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: granstra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Canyon Villas timeshares in Sep 2009. The room that we occupied was a 1 bedroom unit. It was very spacious and very clean. It served our needs perfectly! One of the benefits that you get is being able to use the facilities at the neighboring J.W. Marriott Resort. The pools there were some of the best that I have had the pleasure of using. The fitness center is superb. Overall this was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “RELAXING AND SERENE - Sept. 19 - 26, 2009”
Reviews.Author: Tranquillo
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Canyon Villas was a lovely resort in a serene setting and in an ideal location close to Interstate 101 and Tatum Road. There is a small shopping center across the way called Desert Ridge which also has an AMC Movie Theater and a few restaurants as well as Albertson's grocery store, a Ross Department Store, Marshall's and a Homegoods. There is an abundance of restaurants in Arizona. One of our favorites was Pita Jungle (for healthy meals) and RA Sushi located in Kierland as well as downtown Scottsdale which runs a box special lunch for $9. and a happy hour from 3 - 7 with 1/2 price drinks and appetizers. We went to Sassi Restaurant (upscale) which was very good but expensive. The pool areas are lovely, not too crowded and some areas also have misters to keep you cool. There is a complimentary shuttle every 20 minutes to take you to the JW Marriott Desert Ridge where you can enjoy the busy 2 story lobby, spa, pools and Lazy RIver. Although the Lazy RIver was not crowded when we were there, the lobby was extremely busy with people coming and going as well as many conventions and meetings going on so it seemed noisy. We really enjoyed the spaciousness of the Canyon Villas with a fully equipped kitchen that also had a hidden washer and dryer (so we were able to pack lightly), a nice size dining area, a large living room with a LG flat screen TV, a small and private balcony and a large master bedroom with comfortable King Marriott bed as well as another flat screen TV, a sink and tub off the bedroom and a bath with a large shower and another sink. We were in the 2800 building on the 3rd floor which was extremely convenient to the front lobby, exercise/weight room and pool area. Another nice feature they had was covered parking which is nice in the Arizona heat. It was 105 degrees during the day with no humidity but the inside of the car does get hot. We saved $200 by renting a car from Hertz and picking it up directly at the hotel vs. the airport. There is a Hertz right at the JW Desert..

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: hays5216
Reviews.Content: We spent four days here and loved every day of it. Our only issue was not enough hot water but that was quickly fixed by the staff. We enjoyed this so much we ended up purchasing a time share at the Villas. Hope to get back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Another Marriott's Best”
Reviews.Author: Mai-ImIt
Reviews.Content: Located near shopping mall and 101 Interstate Hwy, this resort is a great place to cool off from the heavy heat of AZ. When it's one of the best, I have few words because I just want to take advantage of what they offer - and that's dependability. I know my stay will be simply what I expected - wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Restful Stay”
Reviews.Author: iamloved
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit and this was one of the worst hotel stays that I've had in recent memory. I could not get any rest and I was tired throughout much of my stay. Much of it had to do with the fact that the people in the room above me were incredibly loud. I couldn't tell if the floors/walls were thin or if the other people were that loud. They made loud bumping and thumping noises throughout the day and into the night. It was as if they were playing football or basketball in the room. I made repeated calls to the front desk, but they were not helpful. The maid service was terrible. It got a little worse each day. I called the front desk on the day when she came in & didn't dump the trash, leave clean facial cloths, wash the tub, leave toiletries, etc. I didn't have a room with a full kitchen. I was in a standard room with a microwave, small fridge, and dishes. The room was small and the quarters were fairly cramped. I had been here for a few days and the sheets clearly needed to be changed. When I complained to the front desk they told me that since it was a timeshare they didn't change sheets, but that they would do it. I didn't pay to stay at a timeshare, I paid for a hotel. They have a shuttle to the mall but it only runs for 3 hours in the morning. After that you have to take the shuttle from Canyon Villas to the main hotel & wait from the city shuttle. Waiting for so many shuttles to and from the main hotel in such oppressive heat was unpleasant. Sometimes the Canyon Villas shuttle would just be sitting outside of the JW, but the driver said that he was not allowed to take a few passengers. He had to wait until every 30 minutes even though the ride would have only taken a couple minutes. I would never stay at this hotel if the main event was at the JW because of how much time you spend shuttling and waiting in the heat. Even beyond that, I wouldn't stay because my room was so noisy & asking for assistance from the staff was a waste of time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Relaxing Vacation at Marriott's Canyon Villas”
Reviews.Author: ASK2005
Reviews.Content: We are on our final day of our week-long stay at Marriott's Canyon Villas. We really enjoyed the resort which has nice size units and great pools. Guests can also take advantage of the facilities at the JW Marriott at Desert Ridge (right next door) which has a really fun and relaxing lazy river pool which we all just loved. The other pools are just a nice and the restaurants are really good too. There is great shopping in the area and a complimentary shuttle bus that goes to the local shopping center. Overall a nice vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: Doone8253
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix for a conference at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge Resort where I stayed 4 nights. I then left and went to the Grand Canyon and stayed in Sedona before returning to Phoenix to fly back home. I stayed one night at the Canyon Villas. I wish I had stayed EVERY night at Canyon Villas. I had a one bedroom villa and it was beautiful. Granite countertops in the full kitchen, washer & dryer were full size as well. The bedroom was a nice size with a nice, large television. Beside the bedroom was a soaking tub and separate vanity/sink that connected to the bathroom that had a large shower, another vanity, etc. The villa was clean, comfortable and very roomy. If people don't mind sharing a bed, 4 people could comfortably sleep in the one bedroom that has a king bed and queen sofabed. We used the pool as well and loved it. In that intense Phoenix heat, I was comfortable lying in a lounge chair in the sun with the misters just above me to keep me cool. There were quite a few families at the pool but it was still very nice and relaxing. For those who want "more" to do, guests of the Canyon Villas have access to the JW Marriott Desert Ridge spa and pools, as well. There is a shuttle that will take you back and forth, but you can also park on your own there. But, self-parking is a long way from the main hotel. Additionally, the parking was covered which kept the car from feeling like an oven when we got in. If I ever go back to Phoenix, I will definitely stay at the Canyon Villas. It was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and not crowded”
Reviews.Author: PAHoosiers
Reviews.Content: Having vacationed 3 times at the Marriot Aruba Surf Club, we were expecting a packed pool and lobby. Nothing can be further from the truth. Every day, we could get poolside chairs no matter what time we arrived. In addition, the pool volleyball and basketball, and the poolside ping pong and pool was awesome for our kids. Only downside is that its HOT here this time of year. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Resort nice, restaurants leave something to be desired”
Reviews.Author: abenti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Canyon Villas in July 2009 for our 10th anniversary in a king studio. The resort was nice. Pools are great. People were helpful. Love that you also have access to all the JW Marriott amenities. The restaurants at the JW were not as good as the rest of the resort. We went off property to local places after the first day. Great pools for kids and adults. We would return!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for families, with access to the JW Marriott for couples”
Reviews.Author: Melroseman2003
Reviews.Content: This property is first-class, not Four Seasons over-the-top luxury, but comfortable and very well done purpose-built timeshare property. Free internet is a nice touch. We stayed in a studio lock-off with limited kitchen facilities, but the small fridge, microwave, toaster and blender, along with plates, silverware, an array of glasses is plenty for most travelers. Pools and hot-tubs are scattered around the property, and several new stainless-steel grills are available for guests to use. There is a "market " on the property that stocks some essentials and DVDs for $1.00. If you'd rather not eat in the unit or cook on the grills there are almost unlimited dining opportunities within minutes. And shopping is plentiful in Phoenix and Scottsdale. For golfers, the area is nirvana. But the real plus is the access to the JW Marriott across the road and golf course. there is a shuttle to the JW every half-hour, and the pools, spa, and restaurants at the JW are great, including a Roy's and an excellent Italian restaurant, Tuscany. It's like staying at the JW. Canyon Villas is great for families, an the access to the JW makes it a great place for single and couples as well.

Reviews.Title: “The best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: travelrusNewMexico
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to come. I and my 2 year old had to go it alone...but met a friend and had the friend stay in a two bedroom resort. It was beautifully decorated and the beds...oh how wonderful to stay in a Marriott Bed. Anyways, the people were very helpful, the kiddie pool was perfect so I could sun bathe while my two year old played in the water. There were wonderful shopping areas within a mile, great restaurants, another fun pool and to top it off we were able to shuttle over to the JW Marriott and use their lazy river and other amenities. It was perfect. I did not have high hopes just us two going, but it turned out to be perfect. I will be returning for sure! Only difficult thing is other than swimming, there is really not a lot to offer young children in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “One bedroom suite ok, grounds not very appealing”
Reviews.Author: MizzRita
Reviews.Content: The one bedroom suite was roomy and typical of a Marriott vacation club suite. However, the grounds were not very appealing. There is a shuttle bus to the JW Marriott and Desert Ridge Shopping Center. The location is great but a car is needed for other than the shuttle bus service. Would probably not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: cksmith1997
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Resort, we loved everything about it. The location is wonderful, close to everything. The staff at the resort are first class all the way, friendly, helpful and fun. The Villa we had (3003) could not have been better. Could not say one bad thing about the Resort. We can not wait to go back and we have told everyone we know how great our trip was especially Canyon Villas.

Reviews.Title: “sunny and happiness”
Reviews.Author: anyaMunster
Reviews.Content: Yes, we titled it sunny, as it was everyday and happiness, because you just feel happy while you are in that area of the US. My husband and I (just shy of our 40's) traveled, as guests with my parents to the villas. They had the main room with the kitchen and living area and we had the "lockout" second bedroom. Everyone has commented on the cleanliness of the villas and we concur! Loved having our own balcony, fridge and microwave in our unit., as well as the separate entrance. Pool area at the villas are nice, however, don't sit by the gated entrances, as the gates slam quite loudly all day long with people running in and out of the area. They really need to change this in the very near future! Also, would be nice to have drink service while you lounge...they don't. But is not a hike at all over to the outdoor bar. See Kelsey, she is awesome!! Must go to the JW Marriott pools!! Property is gorgeous with impeccably groomed landscape, huge palm trees and little streams running everywhere. Pools are quite nice and most lounge chairs have a red flag that you can raise for service~~ excellent. Their sandwiches by the pool are fantastic and only around $12. Domestic beer $4.50 and imports $5.50. Mixed fun drinks are around $9. Order the Waterslide Splash~~ smirnoff raspberry vodka and Citron vodka, Chambord, cranberry juice and lemonade. Lazy river is free and quite nice. As others have written, we did have a problem with our key for the pool, but the front desk at the JW was more than helpful to rectify the situation. Did do the 90 minute presentation for the timeshare and was given $100 in Marriott money. 2 tips: One, the presentation went to 3 hours!!! So, be prepared to say no to both the initial person and then the 2nd person they say they are sending in to do the survey. Noooo, she is there is push another type of deal. Anyway, just be firm if you are not interested, although, in all fairness, it IS interesting!! Two, use the $$$ certificates during your stay at the restaurants or spa. We tried to use them at checkout because we had $400 in food bills and they would not accept them! Thank you to George, at the front desk who tried for us! My Father had to hammer it all out with the sales staff the next day, but we should have just used them during our stay. Did not use the spa, although I did walk in to check it out. Very nice. Numerous restaurants at the JW Marriott. We ate at Roy's, Meritage Steakhouse. Both very good. Prime rib is smoked at Meritage, so if you don't like it smoked (like myself), then order with caution. All others enjoyed their selections. Oh yes, choose the prime rib sliders( three of them) which is a $15 appetizer! So worth it and you won't need an entree! After dinner sit on the outside patio, with the guy playing the guitar, tiki torches lightly burning over at Roy's, palm trees lit with white/lavendar lights and the grassy area with flowers encircling it. See--happiness!! We also went over the the MacDonald Ranch and went horseback riding for an hour ~~ I believe it was only $40 per person. Our young authentic cowboy, Colt, was very nice and grew up w/ horses. They also recommend the moonlight trail ride which we were going to do, but I chickened out thinking bugs would get me. He said it is one of the best rides. My horse, Azul, was so gentle, a 5 year old could have ridden him!! Please tip the wrangler, as he was SO grateful! And as numerous others have written, the Canyon Villa bus is excellent to transport you to various locations. Abundant choices of restaurants close by as well.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in room 3331”
Reviews.Author: Caitie02
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to the Canyon Villas. We were put in room 3331 which is feet away from a six lane highway intersection. The highway noise was so loud we could hardly hear each other talk. I felt like I was staying at a motor lodge, not at a vacation resort. At night you could hear trucks and motorcycles rolling by. We asked to switch rooms, and were given a bit of a run around at the front desk, and eventually told they did not have any rooms to move us to. The block of buildings we stayed in had a small wading pool nearby which was about 1 1/2 feet deep, but my kids got bored easily with that. That meant having to drive to the pool at the canyon villas or drive over to the JW Marriott. If you go to the JW Marriott pool, be prepared, you will have to park far from the front entrance and it is quite a hike back to the pool. There are shuttle busses, but because of our building location we had to drive to the bus stop anyway. I think that if you stayed in several of the other buildings you might be able to walk to the canyon villa pool, but if you are in the outer building near the highway you will need to drive. We also experienced some disatisfaction with the desk clerks. I called 7 or 8 times down to the lobby, and the phone had to ring 10-12 times before someone answered, or there was no answer at all. I am sure it was a busy weekend, so perhaps that is the reason for the slow responses. But they were unable to help us with even the simplest questions, and then told us they would call us back with an answer and never did. We also had problems when we checked out with the kids club charges not hitting up, and an issue surrounding the use of our Marriott gift card. We have checked out of the hotel and I have made six or seven calls and am still working to get this resolved. My kids loved the kids club at the JW Marriott. There is also a mall right across the street. We had pouring rain during one of the days during our vacation, and it was nice to have it as an option to go across the street to the movies.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing stay for everyone”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort for all ages! Great pool area, they even have a kid pool for ages 2-10 that is fantastic. Rooms are large, clean and supplied with anything you need for a great stay. J.W. Marriott is right there, you can use the pool or any of the services while you stay. J.W. has a 5 acre pool area that is alot of fun, lazy river and 4 other pools to hang out by. The food at the pool was good and not over priced. This property has a open feel that you just don't see these days with the price of construction. Shuttle takes you to and from JW as well as the mall across the street. The mall area is a good place to have dinner, shop it even has a grocery store (Albertsons). The Keg restraunt was the best meal for us at the mall. All ages will enjoy this property!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ptsueb
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here! We had a two bedroom villa which had comfortable beds, well-appointed kitchen and furniture, high-speed internet, great pools/hot tubs. The kids loved it. We also had access to the 5-star sister hotel, within walking distance, which had a lazy river. There were other activities for kids including a pool table, "big chess" game. One night (Monday) of entertainment with a singing cowboy. Very close to a large mall with shopping and lots of restaurants. This facility borders a nice golf course, too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: AlisonBuffalo
Reviews.Content: We visited the Marriott's Canyon Villa's from Feb.26th-Mar.2,2009. We had a nice room. The hotel was extremely clean. the beds great. There was a safe, microwave and refrigerator in the room. The hotel staff was very helpful, especially Heather, the concierge ,who helped book my tour. I especially liked the pools. You could also use the pools at the nearby JW Marriott which were awesome. We went on a wonderful tour with DETOURS (they pick you up at the hotel) to the Grand Canyon and Sedona. I would highly recommend this tour if you are in Arizona for only a few days. Go to Talisien West ,Old Town Scottsdale and the Cactus Botannical Gardens. The are MANY MALLS and RESTAURANTS near the hotel-mostly chains. I would highly recommend La Fontanella an authentic Italian restaurant on 4231 E. Indian School Road. You really need to rent a car . Everything, except the malls , is far away.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: WillemIII
Reviews.Content: This a really nice resort style hotel, while it also feels like a very luxury apartment complex with spacious rooms, comfortable living room and a well equipped kitchen. We visited the Phoenix area for 5 days and stayed 4 nights in this hotel with a family with 3 teenagers and a baby. The facilities from the JW Marriot Hotel, just half a mile away, are available to hotel guests. The kids really loved the lazy river and the fact that there is a shuttle every 30 minutes. The same shuttle can take you also to the nearby shopping mall and runs every 30 minutes too. The hotel staff is very friendly and the whole atmosphere is like a small community instead of a hotel, yet with the service you expect in a good hotel. The hotel is kept very clean, fires are lit at night and the pool is open from early in the AM until 11PM with many facilities and hot tubs/whirlpools. The service in the rooms even includes switching on the dishwasher, replenishing paper towels as well as the 'normal' hotel services. We had a really great stay in a picture perfect environment with really nice weather 78+ degrees!

Reviews.Title: “Home-like Feeling in Arizona”
Reviews.Author: DestinyNewMexico
Reviews.Content: Our family prefers suite/condo style accomodations. The Villas offer a home-like atmosphere -very clean, comfortable and decorated very tastefully. The location was handy - some of the best shopping and restaurants in Phoenix just across the road. We've stayed at the Pointe Hilton resorts and Arizona Grand in the past. These suites are definitely larger and an upgrade in comparison, but with a higher rate. The Villa's pool area is nice, but the Pointe resorts' pool areas were more preferable for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona - Yippie Yi Yo”
Reviews.Author: Tbugs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were invited by my sister and bro-in-law to join them at the Marriott Canyon Villas for a week in January. Before I could say "no", my wife said "yes" so we booked flights on Southwest to Phoenix. The Canyon Villas are about 20 miles northeast of the Phoenix airport and are very easy to find - with the help of bro-in-law's Magellan GPS with the nickname of "Maggie". The Desert Ridge shopping center is about a mile from the resort and has every kind of restaurant you could want - from In and Out Burger to microbreweries to high end restaurants. There are also the usual stores like Old Navy, Gap, etc and the all important grocery store (Albertson's) which has a great supply of beer, wine, and liquor. We had a 2 bedroom unit which was perfectly fine. It did not have a great view of anything from the balconies but was very nicely furnished. Marriott has gone away from the glass-topped dining tables because they were just too messy with fingerprints and also with food in the space between the table top and glass. The dining tables are now wood tops and have been "weathered and distressed" at the factories so little scratches do not show up from visitors. Good thinkiing! The lockout portion was very nice with a great king size bed, sofa, flat screen television, dressing area, and good sized bathroom. The master bedroom had a very large bathroom, double sinks and whirlpool tub in the dressing area, a king size bed, chairs, and a television. The kitchen had an electric stove, microwave, coffee maker, dishwasher, and good sized refrigerator. The washer and dryer were behind a kitchen louver door and were the only drawback. They were extremely loud when running - so we used them just before leaving for the day. Canyon Villa guests can use the facilities at the JW Marriott resort and the shuttle bus to and from the resort. We really enjoyed the swimming pool at the JW and the Lazy River area. There is a beautiful golf course (expensive at $199 for guests) but we enjoyed walking the cart paths before golfers got out there. The wildlife was great to see. There are lots of rabbits, coveys of quail, several hawks, lots of cactus wrens, and quite a few hummingbirds to see every morning on the walks. We used Canyon Villas for a base to explore other areas of Arizona such as Prescott, Jerome, Sedona, Mesa, Scottsdale, and Cave Creek. Be sure to go to the red rock country of Sedona and take the famous Pink Jeep Tours. We did the Broken Arrow Trail tour which is 2 hours of off-road trekking over a trail you could not believe a mountain goat could traverse - but the jeep had no problem. Outstanding views! Attend the 90 minute sales presentation and receive a $100 voucher for Roy's (Hawaiian fusion) at the JW or a $100 American Express gift card. No sales pressure and an excellent meal at Roy's. We ate at some other great places, too. I recommend Las Dos Molinas on Central Avenue for a "locals" place which has excellent New Mexico Southwest food (no mild served!) in a casual atmosphere. I recommend reading and packing the AAA Guide for Arizona, taking a good roadmap and a GPS with you to find your way around in an easy way. Enjoy the drives with the views of mountains, arroyos, saguaro cactus, and barrel cactus. This was a very good trip!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: norinice
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice place to stay. Well run, clean, beautifully maintained grounds. They must spend a fortune in landscaping alone because the gardens and greenery are superb! The pools are fabulous. Staying here allows you use of the facilities at the JW Marriott which are amazing. A shuttle transports guests between the two hotels all day. There is a large, entertaining mall just down the road with everything you could imagine. The shuttle also transports you there if you like. I had a rental car and prefer to drive myself. The shuttles are nice though and the staff all around treats you like royalty. Very sophisticated. If you have kids this is the place for you for sure. They will spend the whole day in the many, many pools and be happy. My only possible complaints would be (and this isn't the fault of the hotel per se) the complete lack of any interesting food choices in the area. I can only take but so many chain restaurants. Also, there is a shortage of things to do in the evening. The JW has a lounge singer in the cocktail bar which is nice. But there's really nothing going on at night. Drinks are attractive and well made, but pricey. I can't rave enough about the flora and fauna on the grounds. Quail, rabbits, duck, lizards, cacti. I have tons of pictures I'll definately post. This place is gorgeous! The king size bed has quality cotton sheets and is comfy. The rooms are incredibly clean. Get a one or two bedroom for more than one person because they come with a full size kitchen and living area. The studios are tight. Bring your family here. Relax, and enjoy yourself. I'll be back for sure! Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “This is the One!”
Reviews.Author: daisy921
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort through a getaway from Interval International. I booked a 2-bedroom unit for my husband and me and my sister-in-law and her husband. We arrived early and the clerk was very nice. The unit was a 2-bedroom lock-out so the studio unit was not cleaned but we were able to leave our luggage in the one-bedroom until the studio unit was available. The grocery store and mall was no more than a mile away and easy to access. The resort also have a shuttle bus that will take you the mall (no charge) and to JW Marriott. The Marriott Canyon Villas resort is very clean! The weight room and exercise room are nice but sort of small, which is fine because it was never crowded. Also it is open 24 hours. There are 2 pools at the Marriott Canyon Villas, these are nice but the real treat was the lazy pool at the JW Marriott! We were able to relax to the fullest in the lazy river pool and I really enjoyed the sliding board! All residents at the Marriott Canyon has access to the pools at the JW Marriott Resort. The JW Marriott resort is beautiful! The green grass, tall shady trees and decor is marvelously. The JW Marriott has 4 pools including a nice sprinkler for the little ones. The front desk clerks were exceptionally kind at the Marriott Canyon Villas. They offered to Mapquest anywhere we wanted to visit and made some very good suggestions of activities off the resort. The front desk clerks even offered to print our boarding passes for our return back to Cleveland, Ohio. The Marriott Canyon Villa also had a scheduled sheet for all the activitites on the resort for each day. I would recommend this resort for everyone! I hope to return soon. What a good time we all had! I don't think you could go wrong at this resort even if you are picky! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vacation Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lauriee
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Canyon Villas during the second week of September. We loved the place. We would have preferred a one bedroom unit and were willing to pay an upgraded price however we were told there was no availability? The studio/lock-off unit was small however sufficed. Check-in was easy and friendly staff. Judy, the Concierge at the Canyon Villas is very helpful and always friendly to visit with. We attended the orientation on Monday morning to hear about tours and things to do in the area. This was very helpful. Glad we attended. We took the Segway Tour and this was sooo much fun. The instructor/guide, Darci, is awesome! Other highlights included our Spa Day at the JW Marriott across the street. This Spa is among the best we have ever experienced, absolutely lovely in every way imaginable. If you visit the Spa, be sure to check out the two Owls that inhabit the palm trees located near the outdoor spa. The dining is fantastic. Kierland Commons has a great Tommy Bahama Cafe and Maestro's Fish and Seafood Restaurant. We never made it to Roy's at the JW, however will visit Roy's Asian Fusion Bistro next time and there is no doubt that there will be a next time. Can't end this review without mentioning the beautiful pools at the JW Marriott. Canyon Villas have nice pools too and a great Lizard Lagoon Pool for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Desert Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Chred1
Reviews.Content: We traded through Interval International to stay at the Villas. We had a great time. We stayed in the whole two bedroom unit, which was clean and updated. Unfortunately we were near the construction but there was only one time that I even heard any noise. The main pool was great with waterfalls that provided excellent background. The kids pool was a nice touch also, it'll be even better when they add the third pool. The access to the JW was nice. It has the restaurants, more pools, spa, golf. My wife had a massage and was very impressed by the service and facilities. There is a shuttle but we walked every time, it's not far. I walked to the Starbucks every morning. There is also better outdoor seating at the lounge at the JW. The real key is having the shopping so close. We went to the grocery store and Target rather than bringing supplies with us. We have a six month old so that was key. The restaurant choices there are nice also. I'd recommend BJ's Brewhouse for the pizza and the beer. We also made day trips to Sedona and the Grand Canyon, they were long days but worth it. I would definitely recommend this place to anybody, there was a good mix of singles, married no kids, families, retired.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: kthomas2008
Reviews.Content: This property is emaculate. The check in service was A+++. They were able to get us the best room available (looking over the main pool & top floor). Note that I did call in this request about 9 months before our arrival. The only thing I found that could use some TLC is the concierge desk... they didnt seem to really want to talk to my boyfriend and I because we were not interested in purchasing a timeshare. Plus it seemed like all of their "events" had to do with purchasing a timeshare. I would have enjoyed some other non timeshare sales events: movie night, card night...whatever... without the sales pitch. Anyways the area was fantastic. Nice pools & great views of the AZ sunsets.The property has a shuttle that takes you to the local mall area (many nice places to eat & shop). Our favorite was the Grilled Expedition-- awesome happy hour! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: debt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom from June 25-July 2 and loved the canyon villas. There is so much room and it was wonderful to have free wireless available. Every morning my husband and I walked over to the JWmarriott for coffee and danish at the Starbucks which opens very early for the golfers. It was a very pleasant walk - we did it about 7am. Even though the days were usually 112 degrees, it really didn't bother us. usually from 2-5 if we weren't in the pool, we either went to the movies at the huge shopping complex nearby or were in room there. we even enjoyed the 2 great hot tubs in all that heat. The bigger pool was cooler than I prefer, probably because of the waterfall, so we used the 'lap' pool that wasn't restricted to laps. I loved looking at mountains in the distance everywhere. One day we went swimming at the marriott as I was excited about the lazy river. our cards didn't work in the gate, but someone was there to let us in and told us the villa cards never work. we got tubes and went around about 5 times and then went back to villa. that very night we got a voice mail saying the next day the tubes would be $10/day for a person! I was very glad we went the day we did. we didn't go back. I really think that is terrible. there were plenty of tubes and people used them when they wanted and then put them back. we had a nice pool at the villas so never went swimming again at the marriott. it was so easy to take our rental car and drive to the villas. the roads are all very easy. the shopping complex is so great- has so many restaurants. we ate there each evening. we also saw 2 movies there. we went to mini golf about 12 minutes away and one day went bowling right when it opened and got fantastic rate per game. we took the morning tour in the desert where we were able to shoot six shooters, potato gun and throw tomahawk. my 17 year old thought that was one of best highlights. we took the whole day detours trip to grand canyon. you go to sedona, see the red rocks, have 30minutes in a shopping area, then off to helicopter spot by grand canyon. all 12 of us in the van did it and it was amazing. little pricey but it was a highlight. then off to the south rim and saw the grand canyon from 3 different locations. breathtaking. on way back we stopped at navajo trading post. long day, but wonderful. we also went to heard museum one day which my husband and son found boring, but I enjoyed. we went to taliesin west one morning- get there when they open and definitely take their umbrella to walk around. it was too expensive for what they offered, but I did enjoy it. I really recommend the villas. the price was so much more reasonable that the hotel, we had so much space and the wireless internet was free.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort!”
Reviews.Author: nascar9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom and absolutely loved this place. Check in was a breeze. The front desk people were very nice. As a matter of fact, all the employees (even the maintenance people) were really friendly. The unit we stayed in was nice sized and clean. It came with a few extra stuff that most timeshare units don't provide. (extra TP, paper towels, coffee filters, porcelain coated pans). We all (2 adults and two kids) loved the pools. There were plenty of chairs available at all times. There is a tiki style bar at the pool that serves drinks and food. Prices are what you can expect from a resort type pool bar. Bar staff were really fun to talk to and gave good advice on what to do in the area. They had live "Cowboy Music" on one of the nights that was pretty fun. There are nice gas grills available both near the main building and some near the condo units. There are planned activities for kids and adults you can sign up for. There is a pool table, ping pong table, and a "life sized" chess board to use for guests. As mentioned here, the resort has a free shuttle that will take you to the sister property the JW Marriott and a nearby mall. The mall (Desert Marketplace??) has an Albertsons and a Target store as well as other similar stores including bars and restaurants. As a guest at Canyon Villas, you can use the facilities at JW. The pool here is beautiful. They have a fantastic lazy river that we enjoyed. There are staff on site that will bring a pitcher of ice cold water right to where you sit down by the pool. We booked this thru a "getaway" on II. We have stayed at numerous timeshare properties and the Canyon Villas was the nicest so far.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic scenery”
Reviews.Author: Lindyloo1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at Canyon Villas after a long drive from California. The reception desk was very pleasant and they gave us the keys to the villa and keys to the hotel pool should we wish to use it. Our villa was itself was quite small as it was only an efficiency villa so we didn't have any cooking facilities, we had a comfortable bed and a smallish bathroom. The villa however was clean and quite pleasant, unfortunately the cleaning staff had forgotten to remove coats and trousers that had been left by the people before us and we had to remove these ourselves as nobody came to take them away even though we rang down numerous times and were told somebody was on their way ! The people that owned these coats etc came back for them early evening just before we went out and were fortunate to find us there. When we rang the front desk asking for these to be removed for the fourth time and nobody came we gave up and we thought this was very bad indeed of the staff there. Having said this, we have stayed at the Phoenician in Phoenix and this Resort is a hundred times nicer. However, the whole resort is absolutely fantastic as it is next to the JW Marriott Resort & Spa and you have full use of their facilities. The pools are beautiful, the selection of restaurants are v.good indeed and we went to Roys Asian Cuisine most nights which is situated just at the side of the lounge within the hotel. The hotel is simply beautiful and has every facility imaginable. There is a large Starbucks that opens at 5.30am in order that golfers can grab a coffee and pastry before playing golf as it is 38C by 10.30. We went to Starbucks quite a lot. The most wonderful scenery surrounds this resort and in fact surrounds Phoenix, Scottsdale and Arizona in general and we would love to go back one day as it is a relaxing place to be. The villas are not attractive, there are far better Marriott villas and we can only assume that these were intended to be in keeping with the South Western style. However, the hotel facilities make up for the villas as it is absolutely beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: disneyfanandmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Canyon Villas from May 31 to June 6. We checked into the hotel around 11:00am and our room was not ready, which was fine because we had requested a room on the third floor overlooking the pool.
