However, we came back to check in we were given a second floor room not quite overlooking the pool. However, when I went to fix the kids a snack, the dish area was crawling with ants. I called the front desk and the maintenance man sprayed for the ants. The smelled bothered me and I requested another room. We ended up in building 3300 (the farthest area from the pool) on the first floor looking at the desert (as described, but really some desert plants and a dirt road for the maintenance men.) Our next incident with bugs came after my son took his bath. There was a cockroach behind the toliet. Again the room was sprayed. (Bug season in Arizona is what I was told, haven't had these issues at the Marriott resorts in Florida) I then awoke at 4:00am to use the bathroom and the door was locked. (I closed the door to not smell the spray and the door ended up locking.) Unfortunately, there were no other rooms. During the rest of our visit, we encountered the following items: a missed wake up call, keys that did not work at the JW pool area and an unannouced visit to our room (a request was made for new towels in another room, but our room was changed in error - did not expect someone to entry our room while we were away.) Overall, we enjoyed Arizona. We took the AZ Hummer Tour which was awesome. The best part of the resort was the pool. It would have been nice if an attempt was made to reconcile the issues that we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: AuroraIL
Reviews.Content: WOW! What a timeshare property. I have stayed at a couple of timeshare properties in the past and they have been OK, but nothing like this. I might have to consider purchasing a place here. Before Our Trip: We were contacted by the resort a week prior to checking in to see if there any special requirements that we had. This caught us off guard because we has exchanged through interval to stay here, and we are not even Marriott's owners. We had told them that we would be arriving the morning and they said it would be no problem to drop off our bags at the front desk and get started on our vacation. Check-In: Check-in was a breeze, we arrived about 11am. The guy at the front desk was extremely friendly. Gave us a detailed overview of the Villas and the JW Marriott across the way. Also gave us recommendations of restaurants at the Desert Ridge Marketplace that was close by. He then realized that our room was not ready yet, but checked to see if anything else was available. The was an available room and he let us check-in to that room right away. Room: We were only able to find the efficiency available when we booked on interval, but it was just fine for the two of us. It was just your standard Marriott hotel room that was clean, comfortable, and enough space for the two of us. It did not have a full kitchen, but had a small sink, mini refrigerator, and microwave. If traveling with a family I would recommend at least getting the one bedroom unit. That has more room and a full kitchen and dining area. Pools: I found the pools at both the Canyon Villas and the JW Marriott to be very nice. They were both clean and had plenty of towels to use. I thought the pool at the Canyon Villas was not nearly and busy and cramped at the one at the JW, but the one at the JW did have the benefit of having a lazy river. At the Canyon Villas they gave us a key card to access the pools at the JW. None of them worked, but if you go the the front desk at the JW they will exchange it out for one that will work. All and all it was a fun and relaxing vacation that was further enhanced by the helpful and friendly staff at the Canyon Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Marriott Canyon Villas”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastGirl1
Reviews.Content: We traded through II into this property. We stayed from April 26th to May 3rd. The weather was perfect - high 80s to high 90s during the day and at night you needed a light sweater. We didn't see one cloud the entire week. The villas are only 20 minutes from the airport - very easy access to the highways. We checked in around 5 pm and the staff were very friendly. We were in unit 2959 (the third floor). The units are very nice and comfortable. The bed was great. We had a walk in shower and jacuzzi tub. The balcony was small .. had a table and 4 chairs, but it was a squeeze. The resort offered a few activities as well as activities at the JW Marriott, where you would walk to or take a shuttle. The shuttle also went to the Desert Ridge Marketplace - plenty of shopping and restaurants as well as an 18 screen movie theatre and a supermarket. They are building a new shopping area (right next to the Marketplace) called City Place that will open in the next few years. It will be a more upscale shopping center with Nordstrom and Bloomingdales. I've been told it will be similar to Kierland Commons (near the Westin Resort). We ate dinner at Kierland Commons twice .. once an italian restaurant called North and at a french bistro called Zinc. Zinc had a nice courtyard room where the roof retracts in nice weather. Both had very good food. We went to the Chart House for dinner one night and had a great meal. Their chocolate soufle was wonderful! We also had dinner at Roys over at the Marriott Hotel - very nice. We had dinner on the patio - it was lit with Tiki Torches and they have a firepit. If you dine there on Friday and Saturday nights, you can hear the music from the band that plays outside on the Marriott patio. The pool areas at both the resort and villas was very nice and kept very clean. My husband golfed every day. He loved that he could get out very early in the morning - just after 6 am. We bought the par n'pamper pass for $500 which entitled us to 5 rounds of golf, 5 spa treatments or a combination of the two. Good deal - especially in the high season months! The spa was the nicest I have seen. It had it's own pool with a jacuzzi and very plush lounge chairs. The spa has it's own restaurant and the two services I received were WONDERFUL! I can't wait to go back. Feel free to email me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Familiy Resort - Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Dawn868
Reviews.Content: Timeshare Swap via Interval International - Wonderful family vacation resort with clean villas, pool, playground equipment and all other resort amenities. We stayed in a 1-Bedroom Master Suite that was handicapped accessible - great accommodations for wheelchair/disabled in the bathroom and kitchen for my husband. The shuttle is handicapped accessible for JW Desert Ridge Resort as well as the Marketplace. Great resort activities to keep the family entertained, our 7-Yr old daughter loved the pool selection, and playground, as well as resort activities (Chess/Checkers, Water Balloon Toss, Arts & Crafts, etc). We will definitely return back to the Desert Ridge - after traveling to the West Canyon - welcome vacation resort for rest & relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Want to Leave”
Reviews.Author: fernh
Reviews.Content: We are timeshare owners at this property and booked our stay a year ago. This was our first time staying here a full week. We booked the 2 bedroom villa so our grown kids could stay with us. We requested a golf course view, top floor, quiet, away from construction and that is exactly what we got. Check in was easy. We arrived early, around 2:30pm, and our villa wasn't ready but all we had to do later was come back to get our keys. They took our cell phone number so they could call us when it was ready. The staff there is great and always want to help. We took that time to grab a late lunch and stock up on some supplies at Albertson's. The villa itself was exactly as I remembered and the view of the mountains and the golf course was gorgeous. So, were there any problems? Not really, but there were some things I should mention. I love the Marriott pillowtop beds. The master bedroom and the lockoff beds, however, were not that bed type. They were new but fairly hard mattresses. Not uncomfortable at all. I never woke up with a backache. These must be what they use in all of their timeshares as it was the same at one of the Florida properties we stayed in last year. The sofa bed in the living room was another story. The mattress was incredibly thin. The mattress cover and fitted sheet we got from the closet were too big and bunched up. The top sheet had small tears around the hem. Not what I expected from Marriott but my oldest son wasn't bothered that much. Oh, here's one thing that really bothered me. I like to sleep in a totally dark room. The drapes in the master bedroom and the lockoff were fine, they did close all of the way to block out the light. The problem was the smoke detector in all of the rooms. It had very bright blinking lights. They blinked every 3 seconds. It drove me crazy. Same in the living area and the lockoff. You never notice it until you turn the lights out. I never really got used to it. The pool area was nice and only really crowded the first day. Never any problem parking near the villa either. After staying here, it will be very hard to stay in a regular hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: livewireworld
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here on a time share exchange the week before Xmas and enjoyed every minute of it. It was dark when we arrived, but the resort was colorfully decorated for the holidays. Check-in took less than a couple minutes and we were on our way to our 2-bedroom unit for some much needed rest. The suite seemed very new and was spotless. Each bedroom had a king bed, comfortable bedding, and lots of storage space. The main bedroom had a large soaking tub along with a separate large shower. The suite had three flat-screen TV's each with a DVD player. Lots of channels along with a few HBO and Encore channels. The kitchen is functional with full-size frig (there's a small one in the guest bedroom), microwave, full stove & oven, dishwasher, and washer/dryer. They give you enough dishwasher soap, but you'll need your own laundry detergent. A nice touch was a water feature on one of the walls which added to the relaxing ambience. We were on the first floor so we were only steps from our car in the parking lot. The property itself is quite large. To the east (which is the direction our villa faced) is a golf course and the JW Marriott is probably less than one mile away. To the north is some more of the golf course and some desert landscape. To the west over a wall are some homes, but you hardly notice them. To the south, they've begun construction on the next phase of the resort so I would imagine the villas at that end will be somewhat noisy in 2008. The hotel provides a regular shuttle to the JW Marriott and Desert Ridge Marketplace. The small gift shop really has very little in it. There's also a nice pool area with two waterfalls, whirlpool, large scale chess set, outdoor barbecues, playground, grass volleyball court, pool table, and ping pong table. There is something scheduled at the resort every day for every age group so you can choose whatever you might be intrested in. Being so close to the Desert Ridge Marketplace was a big plus. We ate there, shopped groceries there, saw movies there, and did a little last minute holiday shopping. The resort is close to the freeways, but still feels like it's in a very quiet area which was nice. We all really enjoyed our stay and I'd strongly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Phew!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WalesHolscrazy
Reviews.Content: lbertsons are a 3min drive away. Can't think of anything the supermarket didn't sell, apart from proper baked beans, but then you can never get them in the states! We ate at The Keg, both the steak & the salmon was delicious. We also tried The Bamboo Club - a wide variety of asian dishes on offer. Did not eat at the JW but Roy's looked superb. Very,very hot the entire week but you know before you go so be prepared. Will not be returning - there are too many places out there still to visit, but would recommend both the MCV & Arizona.

Reviews.Title: “This resort is fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gummybarb
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Canyon Villas. We had the two bedroom villa and it was absolutely amazing! It was so big that we got lost in it! We can't say enough good things about this property! We loved the fact that it was so close to Desert Ridge Shopping Mall and soon there will be even more shopping called CIty North. We didn't mind the heat (109 degrees) because we were having so much fun. I highly recommend this property to anyone that likes a first class resort!

Reviews.Title: “Canyon Villas Is Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Philly3
Reviews.Content: This property was wonderful. We booked here for 3 nights on short notice because the JW Marriott Desert Ridge was booked. Our villa was beautiful and spacious. Just what we needed at the end of an 11 day vacation in Arizona. We used the shuttle to the JW each day and enjoyed two fantastic days at the pools there. Our 9 year old loved it and we all hated to leave. Lunch by the pool each day was top notch. With access to all the services, restaurants at the JW plus a gorgeous full size condo, we were in heaven. Cocktails with live music outside on the patio was perfect before dinner at Roy's. Who cares if it is 112 degrees? We stayed at the Fairmont Princess for 4 days at the beginning of our vacation before going to Sedona and Grand Canyon. The Princess was great, but a different experience. We actually liked Canyon Villas/JW Marriott Desert Ridge better. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property...SO relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: travel-travel-Dar
Reviews.Content: This property is immaculate with a true south-west feel. We stayed in 2 bedroom unit overlooking the pool and found it quiet and scenic. The 3rd floor allows views of the mountains and desert. The Desert Ridge Mall is so close but in the heat it is certainly too far to walk with groceries. Albertsons Groceries has everything. The pool was a good size and we loved the misters. The poolbar/snack bar items were reasonably priced and in fact it was cheaper than any resort pool bar/resturant I have ever been to. Great food for kids and adults alike. We looked at the JW resort and took a spin though the lazy river over at the hotel but found it too busy,crowded and over priced. Stay at the villas for a true vacation. The staff were there when you needed them but certainly let you sit and relax. Bottom line, I'd take my family to visit this resort every year. I'd buy a unit here if I could right now!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Diamondgirl
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. We stayed during the week of 6-17/6-24 in a two bedroom villa. Very spacious and everything seemed quite new inside the villa. King bed in each room, the second bedroom is a lock off with its own entrance. The pool area wasn't the biggest but it sure was among the best. Nice waterfalls, great bartender, great drinks and food. JW Marriott just a quick drive away. There is free parking there if you rent a car, also the shuttle service is available. I asked for a certain building (2800) & I received it. Great view of the pool area and the JW Marriott. We have stayed in quite a few Marriott resorts over the years (I do prefer Marriott's) and this is one of the nicest by far.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Canyon Villas”
Reviews.Author: gir7375
Reviews.Content: Very pretty resort, great pool and spacious rooms. Great place to relax. Just a short drive to Phoenix.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott's Canyon Villas
HotelInfo.Address: 5220 E. Marriott Drive, Phoenix, AZ 85054
